text: Creator. For a general bibliography of creation myths, see Alexander N. Am. For bibliographies of North American Indian mythologies arranged by areas, see Thompson Tales 272 n. 1; **Feilberg Skabelses og Syndflodssagn; Jewish: Neuman. Creation of universe by creator. Pre-existing world of gods above. God and devil fly together over primeval water. Creation of earth by creator. Ocean from creator's sweat. Creator appoints chief for each class of created things: Lucifer for demons, Zion for mountains, etc. A1210, Creation of man by creator.
Identity of creator.
Sun-god as creator.
Grandfather as creator.
Stone-woman as creator.
Brahma as creator.
Multiple creators.
Three creators.
First human pair as creators.
Creative mother source of everything.
Reason for creation. Lonely creator.
Gods make earth to have place to rest their feet.
Creator's descendants.
Creator has two sons.
Nature of the creator.
Invisible creator.
Invisibility of creator learned from the impossibility of staring at the sun, his servant.
Hermaphroditic creator. The creator is half man and half woman or is thought of as both male and female. Am.
A111. God of double sex. Hermaphroditic pygmies. Male and female creators.
Animal as creator.
Beast as creator.
Cow as creator. Mankind from salty stone licked by cow. Nectar yielding COW.
Bird as creator.
Raven as creator.

Creator from above.
Woman who fell from the sky. from the sky, is caught by birds, water. She becomes the creator. Cf. Daughter of the sky-chief falls and lowered to the surface of the *Iroquois: Thompson Tales n. 27.
Old man from sky as creator. Old man with his wife comes from the sky. Are the first couple on earth. Have seven sons and seven daughters. Each son marries a daughter.
Creator comes out of chaos.
Creator offspring of dual powers of nature.
Creator from below. God rises from beneath (the center of the spiritual world) and creates the world.
Creator emerges from lake. So. Am.
Creator comes from certain direction.

Creator born from egg. God born from egg.
Creator's companions.

Creator's family.
Creator's son. So. Am.

Beast as creator's companion.
Creator's dog.
Bird as creator's companion. Goddess in form of bird. Helpful birds.
Insect as creator's companion.
Bee as God's spy. God, the creator, sends a bee to overhear the devil's secrets. Secrets learned by deception.
Other animal companions of creator.
Armadillo as creator's companion. So. Am. Dragon. Unicorn. Phoenix.
Joint creators.

Men as God's advisers.

God consults two angels on creation.
God consults mercy on his right and justice on his left.
Devil as adviser of God. Devil as Earth Diver. God and Devil fly together over primeval water. Devil.
Tora as God's adviser.
Souls of pious as Creator's advisers.

Conflict of good and evil creators. Opposition of good and evil gods. Conflict of the gods. Good and bad culture heroes. Dispute at creation of sun. God plans two suns; devil persuades otherwise. Animals created through opposition of devil to God. As result of fraud, Saturn swallows stone instead of infant Jove. Devil.
Creation of angels and devils. Devil as marplot at creation. The devil creates other devils.
Creation of devil(s) (cf.
Creation of angels.
V230. Angels. Angels created to execute God's will.
Degraded gods become angels.
Angels existed prior to creation.
Angels are transformed souls of the pious.
Angels created from three elements.
Angels created from words uttered by God.
God drops water from his finger and the drops become angels. Lucifer imitated God and created devils. Lithuanian: Balys Legends No. 2.
God created angels by striking one small stone with another. Lucifer created devils by imitation. Devils are created by striking two stones together.
Creation of individual angels.
Angel of death created by God.
Angel Michael created from fire.
Angel Gabriel created from snow.
Angel Raphael created from water.
Angel of destruction created from hail and fire.
Time of creation of the angels.
Angels created on first day of creation.
Angels created on second day of creation.
Angels created on third day of creation.
Archangels created on first, angels on third day of creation.
Angels created on fifth day with other winged creatures.
Material of which angels are created (fire, water and snow).
Rebel angels.
Angel of sea rebels at world's creation; put to death by God.
Marplot at creation. An evil opponent attempts to undo or mar the work of the creator. Am. Angels oppose creation of man.
Coyote as marplot at creation.
Devil as marplot at creation.
Devil works during God's sleep at creation. Men die because a snake comes to prey on mankind while creator rests.
Devil plans to drown God at time of creation.
Devil and God wrestle at time of creation.

Devil and God create animals. Wolf created as God's dog. The devil creates goats to destroy things. Bee as God's spy overhears devil's secrets. Revolt of Evil Angels against God. Animals created through opposition of devil to God.

God and the devil torment each other with their creations. Devil pesters God with gnats. God makes a fire and safeguards himself; God plagues the devil with fleas devil is unable to find means of protecting himself. Creation of flea. Creation of gnat.
Lucifer causes fall of man.
Satan seduces Adam to sin because he is jealous of him.
Devil in serpent form tempts first woman (Satan and Eve).
Rebel god is author of all poisonous things.
Poisonous water created by the devil.
Satan attempts to create another world.
God makes things and tosses them into the air; what he catches is good for mankind, what opponent catches is bad.
Creator: miscellaneous motifs.
Creator tries to devour his son, the culture hero. Am.
Original creator followed by transformers. These demigods change the original creation into the present forms. for work of the transformers, with references.
Lonely creator. The creator is tired of solitude and therefore inaugurates the creation. So. Am. Reason for creation.
Reluctant creator.
Creation on condition that Israel accept Tora.
Creator repents of creating certain things.
Creator as ancestor of heaven and earth.
Creator's death.
Creator's works survive him.

Creator of animals.
Creator of buffaloes.
Creation match between goddess-wife, god-husband.
Creator drunk from beverage he invents. So. Am.

Deity. The gods in general. Creator. Why foxes do not live on a certain island: driven out by a god. God in guise of mortal. God transformed to giant with three heads and six arms. Head of divinity as protection of land. Magic invisibility of gods. Person carried to upper world by god. Fairies as descendants of early race of gods. The eaten god.
Supreme god. One god chief of all other gods. No.
Supreme god as creator (cf. Creation of universe by creator.
Characteristics of deity.
Omniscient god. So. Am. Omniscience of a god.
All-seeing god.
Immutable god.
Omnipotent god.
Omnipresent god.
Eternal god.
Holy god.
Sleepless god.
Invisible god.
Unity of God.
Purity of God.
Perfect God.
Loving kindness of God.
Goodness of God.
Modesty of God.
Justice of God.
Anger of God.
Imperfect god, subject to death and rebirth.
Conflict between God's justice and mercy.
Father-god. Man as offspring of creator. First parents children of god.
The making of gods.
Living person becomes god. I passim.
Dead body becomes god. Hawaii: Beckwith Myth 2.
Miscellaneous objects become gods. Hawaii: Beckwith Myth 2.
Spirits become gods.
Opposition of good and evil gods. Conflict of good and evil creators. Giants and gods in fight.
Gods and the demons quarrel over supremacy.
Revolt of bad gods against good. Good and bad culture heroes. Animals created through opposition of devil to God. Battle of gods at end of world.
Goddess rebels against her father for forbidding her marriage.
Revolt of evil angels against God.
Revolting devil banished to hell.
Banished devil appears on earth only on day of dark moon. God of the underworld.
Demon (opposed to God) allowed to earth four times a year (but must let people know who he is and not deceive them).
Satan's fall from heaven.
Created beings rebel against God.
Gods of darkness and light. Darkness thought of as evil, light as good. Recurrent battle. Fairies. Giant. Names of giants (Fomorians) with sinister significance.
God of the living and the dead in the otherworld.
God of the dead. God of the world of the dead. God of death. King of the land of the dead. Voyage to isle of the dead. Sacrifice to the dead.
Deity: miscellaneous motifs.
God as a triad.
Goddess as mother of Pacific Ocean.
Origin of the gods. Origin of spirits. Birth from person's head.

God from adulterous union. Adultery among the gods. Fairies banished for adultery. Adultery.

God in animal form. Am. Totemistic gods. Animal as culture hero. God assumes form of a wolf. God assumes form of calf. God assumes form of a cat. God assumes form of an eel. Divinity reincarnated as bull. Fairy in form of an animal.

Fight of the gods and giants. Gods of darkness and of light. Star deity and drought demon fight. Constant replacement of fighters. In contest between gods and demons, latter are constantly slain and replaced. Defeated giants imprisoned in lower world.
Recurrent battle (everlasting fight) (cf. Slain warriors revive nightly.
Combat between god of light and dragon of ocean.

Combat between thundergod and devil (cf. Devil as shoemaker is struck by lightning. Devil hides in the folds of clothes of people running from storm. Devil appears during thunder storm, seeking shelter among people. Dupe deceived concerning thunder. Man saves the unrecognized devil from thunder. Death by thunderbolt as punishment. Thunder slays people for disregard for him.
Devil (ogre) steals thunder's instruments.
Thunder and lightning slay devils.

Culture hero builds raths. Origin of raths. Fort produced by magic. Giants as builders of great structures.
Culture hero teaches arts and crafts. Am. God plants fields. God of trades and professions. Acquisition of human culture.
Culture hero invents and teaches the Irish language. God of eloquence and learning as inventor of ogam alphabet.
Culture hero as god of agriculture. God of agriculture.
Culture hero establishes customs. Misplaced genitalia. Originally genitals are misplaced; conception and childbirth are not understood. All is arranged by culture hero. Origin of customs. Customs.
Culture hero establishes social system. Origin of customs. P. Society.
Culture hero dispenses food and hospitality. Hospitality.
Culture hero's (demigod's) departure. Culture hero arrives (and departs) in boat. Islands of the blessed. Journey to the otherworld. Journey to earthly paradise. Otherworld on an island.
Divinity's departure for west. Am. Islands of the blest. Elysium situated in the west.
Divinity's departure for east. Am.
Remarkable longevity of culture heroes. Great age of the gods. Culture hero still lives.

Dying culture hero. The culture hero teaches people how to die by dying himself. Origin of minerals from body of dead culture hero. Fairy women take body of dead hero to fairyland. Fairies bear dead warrior to fairyland.
Culture hero returns to upper world. S. Am.
Return of mortal reincarnation of celestial being to the country of the gods after his mission has been accomplished on earth. Culture hero incarnated through birth from virgin.
Culture hero ascends to heaven guided by blind ancestress.
Divinity retires to the end of the world. S. Am.
Culture hero still lives. Remarkable longevity of culture heroes.
Culture hero asleep in mountain. Culture hero's expected return. Habitable hill.
Culture hero still alive in hollow hill. Home of gods inside of hill. Fairyland under a hollow knoll. Hollow mountain.
Culture hero still alive on mysterious island. Islands of the blest. Avalon.
Culture hero still keeps watch over earth. S. Am.
Culture hero still resides in the zenith. S. Am.
Departed deity grants requests to visitors. Acquisition of magic powers. Journey to see deity. Modest request best. Request for immortality punished by transformation into tree.

Culture hero's (divinity's) expected return. Divinity or hero is expected to return at the proper time and rescue his people from their misfortunes. Bolte Zs. f. Vksk. Aztec: Alexander Lat. Am. Culture hero asleep in mountain. Horse born of egg. Mythical hero will come riding on such a horse. King asleep in mountain.
Culture hero (divinity) returns. Friendly return from the dead. Voyage to the land of youth. Return from fairyland.
Culture hero returns and assists mortals. Fairy visits among mortals.

Culture hero returns and aids followers in battle. Gods intervene in battle. Demigods act as allies of mortals. Fairy aids mortal in battle. Culture hero returns to prove power of saint. Return from dead to convert to Christianity. Saints.
Demigods and culture heroes-miscellaneous.
Semi-divine hero granted free access to men's wives. Sex hospitality.
Culture heroes and descendants.
Demigod and witch woman of upper world have son.
Virgin daughter of culture hero. S. Am.
Daughter of culture hero gives birth to boy. S. Am.
Creation of the universe. Rel. Am. Creator.
Universe created in specified time and order.
Universe created in five periods of time.
Universe created in six days.
Primeval chaos. First deity grows out of primeval chaos. Spontaneous creation of universe. Primeval water.
Primeval darkness. S. Am.
Primeval cold.

Creation of universe by creator. The creator is existing before all things. Alexander Lat. Creator. Supreme god as creator. Creation of earth by creator. Topographical features caused by experiences of primitive hero (demigod, deity).
All things created in pairs (heaven and earth, etc.
Creation of heaven, earth, and hell. Heaven. Hell.
Fiat creation. Universe is created at command of creator. Magic results produced by command. Judgments and decrees.
Creator uses particular formula (letters) to create universe.
Druids as creators.
Creation: materialization of creator's thinking. Creator "thinks outward in space" and thus produces the universe. The universe a manifestation of the creator.
Creation from creator's tears.
Universe from parts of creator's body. Ymir makes the world from his members — mountains from bones, cliffs from teeth, heavens from skull, etc. Man made from creator's body.
Universe from parts of man's body.
Universe as offspring of creator. The Sky Father begets various parts of the universe by his various wives. Creation of universe: genealogical type. A begets B, who begets C, etc.
Universe from creator's masturbation with water, with stone, and with earth.
Universe from copulation of various objects to produce others.
Creation of universe from clam-shell on primeval water by creator.
Creation of universe from clay pot set afloat on primeval waters. Primeval water.
Creation of universe from calabash.
Universe created by various activities of creator.
Universe coughed into being.
A636. New creation shouted away. Universe created by spitting.
Spontaneous creation of universe. Primeval chaos.
Spontaneous creation evolutionary type. From primeval chaos gradually arise worlds and life. Creation of universe: genealogical type. Creation of man through evolution.
Spontaneous encroachment of heavens and earth checked by creator.
Universe from congealed vapor.
Creation from vapor-produced primeval giant. Vapors from half-frozen primeval river origin of giant Ymir, from whom universe is created. Universe from body of slain giant.
Universe created out of fire world. Land of fire.
Universe created out of ice and mist.
World parents: sky-father and earth-mother as parents of the' universe. The sky-father descends upon the earth-mother and begets the world. Am. Mother earth.
Heaven-mother Indo-Chinese 263.
Raising of the sky. Originally the sky is near the earth (usually because of the conjunction of the sky-father and earth-mother). It is raised to its present place. Raising the sun.
Heaven and earth originally connected by navel string. Navel string cut.
Why the sky receded upward: it was struck by a woman's pestle.
Raising the sky: striking with broom. Old woman's hump strikes clouds as she sweeps. She strikes at sky with broom and thus raises it.
Deity clothes his father the sky after he has separated him from earth.
After sky is lifted, plants and shrubs begin to grow.

Series of creations. Series of creations.. The present universe is the last of a succession of creations. Am. Hierarchy of worlds. The four ages of the world. Man created after series of unsuccessful experiments.

Pre-existing world of gods above. Such a world is assumed before the real creation of the universe. Though this belief is not explicitly set forth in many mythologies, it seems to be implied in most of the North American Indian systems.
Succession of creations and cataclysms. From the ruins of each earlier creation a new one is raised.
Earlier universe opposite of present. Everything in the earlier world was the reverse of the present world.
New creation shouted away. It is unstable and therefore unsatisfactory.
Other means of creating the universe.
Cosmic egg. The universe brought forth from an egg. Lang Myth.

— A655. World as egg. Origin of sky from egg brought from primeval water. Mankind originates from eggs. IndoHeaven and earth from egg. They are the two halves of an egg shell. Eros escapes as they are separated.

Creation from duck's eggs. Upper vault from half shell, lower vault from half shell, moonbeams from whites, sunshine from yellows, starlight from motley parts, clouds from dark parts. Kalevala rune 1. —
Universe from body of slain giant. Ymir.
Primeval woman cut in pieces: houses, etc. Primeval woman cut in pieces: houses, etc., made from her body.
Universe from pre-existing rocks. Originally rocks are assumed and everything is made from them.
Creation of universe: genealogical type. A begets B, who begets C, etc. Finally the universe is brought forth in its present form. Nias Is. Universe as offspring of creator. Sun born of first couple.
Universe from cosmic fowl.
The universe as a whole.
Hierarchy of worlds. A series of worlds, one above the other. Series of creations. Heavenly hierarchy.
Nine worlds.
Four world systems.
Series of upper worlds. Journeys to the upper world.
Highest of celestial worlds consists of twenty heavens.
Three heavens. Snorra Edda Gylf XVII, Boberg.
Third sky above prevents earth being burned by sun. S. Am.
Region above the three worlds.
Four heavens. S. Am.
Five heavens. S. Am.
Seven heavens. A series of seven upper worlds. Seven as magic number.
Eight heavens.
Nine heavens.
The nine ranks (orders) of heaven. Nine as magic number.
Ten heavens.
Series of upper worlds miscellaneous.
Seventeen-storied heaven.
Series of lower worlds. Series of hells. Journey to the lower world.
Creator lives in lowest sky beneath us. S. Am. Deity ruler of lowest heaven.
Two lower worlds. S. Am.
Three lower worlds. S. Am.
Seven lower worlds.
Worlds above and below.
Seven worlds above and below. An angel upholds the seven worlds on his shoulders.
Worlds above and below miscellaneous.
World-tree. Tree extending from lowest to highest world. Sun and moon placed in top of tree. Magic tree. Tree of life. Tree of Life in otherworld.
Tree to heaven. Am. Tree supports sky. Tree to upper world.
Tree to heaven from goddess' necklace which she hangs on branch.
Tree hanging from sky. A tree hangs upside down in the sky. By its branches men pass back and forth to the upper world.
Tree in upper world.
Sky as overshadowing tree. Shadowing the earth.
Earth under umbrella.
Primary elements of universe. Cf. the early Greek philosophers.
World as egg. The two halves are heaven and earth. Cosmic egg. Origin of sky from egg brought from primeval water.
River connecting earth and upper and lower worlds.
Bridge connecting earth and heaven. Boberg.
F152. Bridge to otherworld. Heaven and earth touch each other at east, west, and south.
Size and distances of the universe.
Nine days' fall from heaven to earth; the same from earth to hell.
Nine nights' riding from heaven (or earth) to hell.
Five hundred years travel across universe.
The universe as a whole miscellaneous.
Music of the spheres. (The general philosophical theory of the music of the spheres is not treated here). Singing heavens and earth.
Big lake under the earth. S. Am.
River's source where sky and earth meet. S. Am.
Each world corresponds to different color. S. Am.
Nature of the upper world. Rain from sea in upper world. Journey to upper world. Sky window. Quest to the upper world.
Heaven. A blissful upper world. God of heaven. Beautiful land of dead. Souls in heaven. Reward: admission to heaven. Man admitted to neither heaven nor hell. Visions of heaven.
Gate of heaven. Gate to upper world. Door entrance to lower world. Door to otherworld.
Gate of heaven guarded by clap of thunder and mysterious sword.
Doors of heaven guarded by rivers of fire. The fires of hell. River in heaven burns wicked and gives joy to righteous.
Veils of fire and ice before chief door of heaven. Alternate heat and cold in hell.
Saint Peter as porter of heaven. Heaven entered by a trick. Saints.
Archangels Michael and Ariel as porters of two of the doors of heaven.
Abersetus as guardian of river of fire at one of the doors of heaven.
Virgins with iron rods as guardians of two of the doors in heaven.
Music in heaven.
Heavenly music caused by four columns under Lord's chair. Birds in otherworld sing religious songs.
Music produced by precious stones in heaven.
Chairs in heaven.
V515. Allegorical vision of chairs in heaven. Three chairs in heaven for three saints. Cleansing fountain in heaven.
Bridge of heaven. Bridge to otherworld.
Soul-bridge: easy for righteous to cross, more difficult for others. Ability to cross bridge as test of righteousness.
Windows in heaven: sixty-six (seventy-two) windows in the firmament. Windows in firmament shed light. Windows in otherworld.
Self-illuminating precious stones in heaven.
Sweet odor in heaven.
Heaven surrounded by seven walls. Fence of metal or crystal in otherworld.
Land of the saints surrounded by fiery circle. Visions of land of the saints,
Valhalla. The hall of warriors who go to Odin. They die and are resurrected daily. Scand. Home of the gods. Slain warriors revive nightly.
Valhalla has five hundred and forty doors.
Goat (Heidrún) in Valhalla gives mead.
Hog (Sæhrímnir) in Valhalla gives meat. Boberg.
Deer (Eikþyrnir) in Valhalla fills the fountain Hvergelmir. Boberg.
Cock in Valhalla awakens the gods.
Inhabitants of heaven divided into companies.
Saint sees vision of three cities in heaven: a city of gold, a city of silver, a city of glass. City of precious metals and stones. Visions of heaven.
The eight paradises.
Five trees of paradise.
Girls dancing in heaven.
Upper world (heaven) as a mountain. The sky is the hollowed under side of the mountain.
The plains of heaven. Otherworld as plain. Plain that is earthly paradise.
Support of the sky. Sky supported by north star.
God stabilizes the sky.
God of space upholds sky. Bird thinks that the sky will fall if he does not support it.
Pillar supporting sky.
Pillars supporting sky.
Four sky-columns. Four columns support the sky.
Four gods at world-quarters support the sky. Atlas.
Four dwarfs support the sky.
Sky extended by means of pillars.
Mountain supports sky. Home of gods on high mountain. Otherworld on lofty mountain.
Four mountains support sky.
Tree supports sky.
Sky held against earth by great octopus.
Serpent supports sky. S. Am.
Ladder to heaven (applied to saint).
Eight (symbolical) steps of the ladder of heaven.
Rodent gnaws away ladder to other world and thus ghosts remain on earth. S. Am.
Language of heaven. Hebrew the language of the inhabitants of heaven.
Nature of the upper world miscellaneous.
Judges in the upper world.
Sky of solid substance. S. Am.
Nature of the lower world. Journey to lower world. Quest to lower world.

Hell. Lower world of torment. Dragons in hell. Lucifer as serpent. Abode of the dead. Land of dead in lower world. Destination of the soul. Descent to lower world of dead. Punishments in hell. Man admitted to neither heaven nor hell. Visions of hell. Salvation.
Hell located to the north. Land of death in north. Punishment by cold in hell. North as abode of evil spirits.
Other locations for hell.
Creation of hell.
Fire in hell. Christ created fire in hell from his blood; formerly hell was cold.
Entrance to cave as gate to hell. Door to otherworld. Pit entrance to otherworld. Entrance to fairyland through door in knoll. Vision of gate to hell.
Hell confused with fairy land. Fairy otherworld confused with land of the dead. Otherworld (fairy land) as place of sorrowful captivity. Fairies as demons. Malevolent or destructive fairies.
Size and arrangements of hell.
Doorkeeper of hell. Lost soul to serve as porter in hell for seven years,
Horrible sights in hell. Souls in hell. Punishments in hell.
Serpents in hell.
Adders in hell. Fiery chains in the form of adders about waists of souls tormented in hell.
Rivers of blood in hell.
Rivers of poison in hell.
River in hell filled with weapons.
Rivers of fire in hell. River of fire as barrier to otherworld.
Rivers of black water in hell. Black as magic color. Land of dead across water.
Four (three) rivers in hell.
Other rivers in hell. Rivers in other world.
Tree in hell made of living heads of the dead.
The fires of hell.
E750. Perils of the soul. Punishments by heat in hell. Vision of fires of hell. Sea of fire in hell.
Islands in sea of fire in hell. Magic sea.
Fiery showers in hell. Showers of fire fall on sinners in hell. fiery arrows at souls in hell.
Burning plains in hell. Demons shoot
Fiery glens in hell. Perious valley in (on way to) land of dead. Perilous glen on way to otherworld. Glen of witchcraft.
Fiery wheels in hell. Fiery wheels about necks of souls tormented in hell.
Fiery chains in hell. Fiery chains in the form of adders about waists of souls tormented in hell.
Fiery sticks in hell.
Fiery stones in hell.
Fiery nails in hell. Fiery nails through tongues of souls tormented in hell.
Fiery columns in hell. Pillars of silver and glass in otherworld. Tormented souls bound to fiery columns in hell.
Swift, flaming winds in hell.
Four fires in hell. Four as magic number. The four rivers of paradise.
Dragons in hell.
Wolf in hell.
Gnats in hell.
Toads in hell. Blood of toad venemous.
Scorpions in hell.
Griffins in hell. Griffin.
Birds made of iron in hell.
Lions in hell.
Scratching cats in hell.
Tigers in hell.
Frigidity of hell. Magic control of cold and heat. Icy inferno. Icy hell. Punishments by cold in hell.
Coldness in hell.
Rugged, icy mountains in hell. Extraordinary mountains and other land features. Alternate heat and cold in hell. Pain of souls tormented in hell alternately ebbs and flows.
Well in hell (Hvergelmir). Gate around hell. Beings born in hell have long bodies and cling with long nails to walls.
Stygian river. River in lower world. Land of dead across water. The four rivers of paradise.
Ferryman on river in lower world (Charon). Access to lower world.
Charon exacts fee to ferry souls across Styx. Coin placed in mouth of dead to prevent return.
Maiden at the bridge to hell.

Hound of hell. Cerberus (monstrous dog) guards the bridge to the lower world. Rel. Cerberus. Magic dog. Animal bribed with food. Animal as guard of person or house. Bridge to land of dead. Hell-hounds accompany soul to lower world. Entrance to otherworld guarded by monsters. Bridge to otherworld guarded by animals. Quest for Cerberus in hell.
Dogs in hell. Magic dog.
Cock of hell. Boberg.
Judges in the lower world.
Ship of hell.
Workmen and tradesmen of hell.
Smith of hell.
Miller of hell. Miller.
In other world one room contains the dead, another contains souls of the unborn waiting to enter the wombs of women, and a third contains all the evil spirits.
Sun in the underworld. S. Am.
Hole to lower world up which people come. S. Am. Mankind ascends from under the earth.
Nature of the lower world — miscellaneous.
Dark puddles in hell. Sinners in hell forced to sit in dark puddles up to their middles.
Foul odor in hell.
Hunger in hell.
Dogs incited to devour souls in hell.
Miscellaneous worlds. Journey to terrestrial otherworlds.

Islands of the blest. Divinity's departure for west. Magic island. Magic apple from Garden of the Hesperides. Land of dead across water. Journey to earthly paradise. Land of happiness. Journey to land of women. Journey to land of the immortals. Voyage to island of the dead. Otherworld on island. Fairyland on island. Extraordinary islands.
Overseas otherworld in the west.
Intermediate future world. Residence for those whose good and evil deeds exactly counterbalance. The two sorrows of the kingdom of heaven. Rewards and punishments. Visions of purgatory. Salvation.
Christian paradise. Journey to earthly paradise.
Christian paradise (Terra Repromissionis) corresponding to pagan Celtic otherworld (Ireland).
F110. Journey to terrestrial otherworlds. Pagan otherworld identified with Christian paradise. Plain that is earthly paradise. Moon as next world.
World of serpents.
Various Buddhist otherworlds.
Brahma world.
Tusita world.
Years are days in Tusita world. Years thought days.
Deva world.
Creation of the heavenly bodies. Magic object controls heavenly bodies. Extraordinary behavior of heavenly bodies.

Heavenly bodies from objects thrown into sky. The Christ Child throws mud pies into the sky and creates sun, moon, and stars. Sun from object thrown into sky. Origin of moon from object (person) thrown into sky. Stars from objects thrown into sky.
Heavenly bodies vomited up by creator.
A woman has four children: sun, moon, fire, and water.
14f. Heavenly bodies created after the plant world. Sun, moon, and stars forged by smith.
Sun and moon purchased.
Sun, moon, and stars nourished on fire.
Sun, moon, and darkness as god's three children.
Creation of the sky.
Creation of firmament.
Origin of sky from egg brought from primeval water. Cosmic egg. World as egg. Earth from egg from bottom of sea.
Origin of sky from Ymir's skull.
Nature of the sky. Sky rope. Mountain reaches to sky. Sky window. Rising and falling sky.
Sky of water. The sky consists of water.
Sky as solid vault (tent). Cf.
Sky supported by north star (“nail of the north") around which it revolves.
Celestial bodies attached to a wheel in heaven around which they move.
Why the sky is blue.
Marriage of earth and sky.
Sky measured by bird.
Clouds as props of the sky.
Sky is black because once raised by means of dirty stick. Raising the sky.
Sky immortal, changing skin like a snake. S. Am.
Angels arrange course of heavenly bodies.
Origin and nature of clouds.
Origin of clouds.
Creator makes clouds from own vitals.
Clouds as tapa beaten out by woman in moon.
Nature of clouds (covered with skin).
Creation of the sun. Extraordinary behavior of sun.
Sun as man who left earth. Man, usually of supernatural birth, ascends to the sky and becomes the sun.
Sun and moon as uncle and nephew who ascended to the sky.
Sun as a cannibal. Sun-moon quarrel when sun eats up all their children but two. Kinds of cannibals.
Originally a moon but no sun.
Originally no sun.
Sun as fire rekindled every morning.
Moon from light, sun from fire.
Sun and moon from cave. Am.
Sun and moon from belly of a fish.
Sun from object thrown into sky.
A700. Heavenly bodies from objects thrown into sky. Sun and moon placed for eyes in the sky.

Sun and moon placed in top of tree. Hero makes the sun and moon and fastens them to the top of the "World Tree" (cf. A652), but they give no light at first. Magic song causes tree to rise to sky. Has moon and Great Bear in its branches.
Sun from fire flung into sky.
Sun and moon metal mirrors in sky.
Sun as grindstone full of fire.
Sun and moon as spangle which falls from creator's forehead into his own urine.
Sun and moon as eyes of Rama which he tore out after his brother's death.
Wooden circles that were the sun and moon animated after human sacrifice of blood. Creation of the moon.
Sun born of first couple.
Sun and moon born from a woman. Creation of universe: genealogical type.
Sun and moon born from a goddess impregnated by the wind. Conception from wind.
Sun and moon born from an ogre.
Sun and moon from breasts of mother earth.
Sun as offspring of moon.
Sun and moon born of lizard. S. Am.
Dispute at creation of sun. God and devil discuss creation. God plans two suns; devil persuades him to create only one.
Four suns at first: culture hero shoots three down.
Hero makes sun and moon from tree and sends them alternately into sky.
Hero makes sun and moon from tree and vivifies them with blood of creator's son.
Sun from transformation.
Sun from head of youth offered in sacrifice.
Sun and moon as divine bodies of gods.
Sun from fruit kernels thrown into water of flood. S. Am.
Sun from transformed maggots.
Creation of sun miscellaneous.
Sun emerges from lake. S. Am.
After world catastrophe, new sun reappears and starts new epoch. S. Am. World catastrophe.
Sun created on fourth day of creation.
Nature and condition of the sun.
A220. Hat which turns the sun. Visit to land of the sun. Formerly seven suns.
Formerly great heat of sun causes distress to mankind.
Sun kept in box. Moon kept in box.
Sun and moon kept in pots when they do not shine. S. Am. Am. Cf.
Sun shut up in pit.
Sun kept in a case.
Theft of sun. The sun, which is kept by a monster, is stolen and brought to earth. Indian: Gayton and Newman 60; S. Am. Theft of the moon. Theft of light. Theft of fire.
Sun swallowed and spit out. In theft of sun, the raven (or devil) thus succeeds.
Great darkness due to awk swallowing the sun.
Stolen sun restored to sky. Calif.
Pale sun made right again by using egg, yellow grass, etc.
Sun falls but is lifted back to sky and tied to it. S. Am.
Sun's night journey. Around or under the earth. Fools believe sun sleeps at certain woman's house.
Sun's night journey in golden goblet. Helios' chariot is conveyed eastward at night in a golden goblet (or bed).
Sun's night journey with reversed face. It returns from west to east by the same way that it came, but it turns its light side to the sky and leaves the earth in darkness.
Sun's night journey: in land of dead.
Sun at night closes doors. In evening goes home and shuts doors and windows.
Sun at night lowers arm. The sun, a man, lies with arm uplifted. The shining comes from his armpits. When his arm is lowered the shining ceases.
Sun bathes in stream of fire at night.
Sun led through stream to cool off heat at night; otherwise might consume earth.
Sun hidden at night because afraid to wander.
Mountain where sun goes through.
Sun at night enters fissure between sky and earth. S. Am.
Sun sits on back of a male buffalo.
At dawn sun comes to play with the moon.
Sun and moon to remain half their time in underworld.
Sun worships God by night.
Visible sun is the "pet" of real sun. S. Am.
Sun is man during day.
Boat of the sun.
Chariot of the sun.
Charioteer of the sun. Sun drives his horses and chariot across sky. Flying horse. Flight so high that sun melts glue of artificial wings. Attempt to fly to heaven punished.
Coyote rides with sun. Coyote rides with sun. Calif.
Phaëton. Sun entrusts his chariot to another (his son) and the horses run away. The world is almost burnt up.
Chariot of sun accompanied by angels.
The sun a golden bowl on the rim of which sits a peacock; both bowl and peacock are in a crystal box, which rests on a flying chariot. Sun kept in box.
Man controls rising and setting of sun.
D1546. Magic spell controls sun. Sun does not set for a year through power of saint. Miraculous manifestation acclaims saint.
Daily course of sun across sky.
Sun and moon make daily tour under direct orders of God.
Wings of sun.
Raising the sun. Originally low, it is raised little by little by conjurors. Alexander N. Am. Raising the sky.
Sun originally so hot that it threatens all life.
Sun caught in snare. Luomala Oceanic, American Indian, and African Myths of Snaring the Sun (BMB No. 168

H1023. Task: to tie the sun with a gold chain. A boy is angered because the sun burned his mantle. He makes a snare and catches the sun and delays him so that everything is burning up. A mouse finally gnaws the snare in two. Cf. Luomala.

Sun-snarer: fast sun. The sun goes too fast to dry clothing. The hero snares the sun's legs with a rope as he is climbing up from the underworld. He releases the sun upon the promise to go more slowly. Cf. Luomala.
Sun visits earth in form of black bull, caught by man, thus causing night.
Sun and moon carried through sky by animals. Speed depends upon hour and season.
Sun as king of sky and earth.
Sun sits on throne.
Crown of the sun.
The sun's animals.
Cattle and sheep of the sun. 350 of each (= days and nights of the lunar year). Riddle of the year.
Horse of the sun.
Slave shoots arrow into leg of sun's horse.
Heat and light of the sun.
Why sunlight is so much stronger than moonlight.
Mortal cannot look at sun since God's name is engraved on it.
Two faces of the sun: fire, directed toward earth; hail, directed toward heaven.
Beams of light are snares with which sun is tied to earth.
Sun dries out earth with its heat.
Sun hides.
Sun hides in cave.
Pursuit of sun by moon.
Moon tied to sun so that when sun sinks moon is dragged up to light earth.
Sun and moon pursued by dark planet in black chariot.
Sun as human being.
Sun and moon as man and woman.

Sun sister and moon brother. Brother visits sister at night. She marks him to identify him. He flees and she follows with flaming brand. She is sun and he the moon. d. deutschen Moon wants to marry his sister the sun. She is angered and throws hot ashes on his face. Clandestine lover is identified by paint marks left on his skin by his mistress. Sister escapes to the stars to avoid marrying brother.
Sun-brother and moon-sister. Alexander N. Am.
Sun and moon as lovers. ThompsonBalys. S. Am. Moon as wooer.
Sun and moon married. Am.
Sun and moon quarrel when sun eats up all their children but two. Sun as cannibal.
Moon kills sun's children.
Moon, sun are sister and brother, wife and husband.
Creator separates sun and moon to prevent birth of more stars.
Sun as XXXX 20. woman. S. Am.
Sun and moon as brothers. N. Am.
Sun and moon as twin brothers. S. Am. Twin culture heroes.
Sun and moon brothers: sun clever, moon stupid. S. Am.
Balys. Sun and his brother rise and set alternately.
Sun and moon as sisters, daughters of sky-god.
Children of the sun.
Son of sun so hot no one can hold it. S. Am.
Children from union with the sun turn into bit of blood in daytime as soon as they are exposed to sun; take human form (shape) again at sunset. Conception from sunlight.
Sun and moon as friends.
Sun's affection for human girl rouses moon's jealousy.
Sun marries woman.
Original moon changed into sun and sun into moon.
Sun cursed by moon.
Human son of sun. Contest between sun and moon.
Causes of eclipses (sun or moon). d. deutschen Am. Continuous world eclipse.
Origin of eclipse of moon.
Eclipse caused by monster devouring sun or moon. Lowie ibid.
Cause of eclipses: mother's curse laid upon her third son.
Toad causes eclipses of the sun.
Ghosts of the sun's children return to cause eclipse. Ghost of murdered child.
Moon's eclipse caused by moon's interfering between attacker and person attacked.
Eclipses caused by animal hiding sun behind his body. S. Am.
Eclipses from quarrels between moon and sun. S. Am.
Eclipses when sun smears his face on account of mourning. S. Am.
Sun hides face in shame: eclipse.
Eclipse as punishment by deity.
Eclipses because sun cannot endure tragic happenings of history.
Partial eclipses because of ailments of sun or moon. S. Am.
Attributes of sun.
Physical attributes.
Sun and moon are balls of feathers. S. Am.
Sun a fat woman walking across sky. S. Am.
Mental powers and disposition of sun.
Religious sun and moon.
Sun endowed with wisdom and passion.
Sun's healing powers.
Sun's power over plants.
Nature and condition of the sun --miscellaneous.
Sun at the edge of the sky.
War with the sun.
Each of sun brothers works for a month and plays for the other eleven; were they to work all together, the world would be burned up by the heat.
Reason for variations in seasonal heat of sun.
Why the sun is red.
Sun sets and refuses to rise: must be coaxed back from underworld.
Sun's all-seeing eye.
Sun as caretaker of the poor. S. Am.
Sun has weapons of iron to repel enemies. S. Am.

Creation of the moon. Am. Sun and moon as uncle and nephew who ascended to the sky. Sun and moon from cave. Sun and moon placed for eyes in the sky. Wooden circles that were sun and moon animated after human sacrifices of blood.
Moon from object (person) thrown into sky. Heavenly bodies from objects thrown into sky. Sun and moon placed in top of tree.
Moon is water slung into sky.
Chest of sacrificed youth becomes the moon.
Moon as grinder which brings fire out of the sun.

Moon made from shining fragments. A cap is opened and shining things fall out. Children pick them up and put them into a box. At the end of the month the box is full. The full moon shines when all the fragments are gathered together.
Moon from transformed object.
Origin of moon from shell.
Heavenly smith is hammering on the moon.
Family of the moon.
Moon born from first couple. Gilbert Is.
Mother of the moon: the most distant star in the sky.
Moon younger brother of the sun. Sun and moon as brothers.
Person transformed to moon. Transformation: man to object.
Nature and condition of the moon. Moon as next world. Visit to land of moon.
Man in the moon. A man is said to be seen in the moon. Various explanations are given as to how he came to be there. ; Basset RTP XXIII 220 and references to earlier volumes.
Man in moon is person thrown or sent there as punishment.
Man in moon has punishment for burning brush on Sunday. Tabu: breaking the sabbath. Person carried to other world for breaking tabu. Wild huntsman wanders for hunting on Sunday.
Man in moon is put there as punishment for cursing God. Baughman.
Man in moon as punishment for disdainful sacrifice (Cain). Religious sacrifices.
Man in moon banished there for stealing bundle of thorns.
Man in the moon a rabbit (hare, other animal). Am.
Frog in moon. S. Am.
Man in moon a frog which has jumped into person's face and remains there. Undutiful son punished by toad clinging to face.
Man in the moon: tarring of the moon. Man sets out to tar the moon and remains with his tar-bucket in the moon.
Man in the moon from scratches or paint. S. Am.
Man in the moon: moon's face scratched by hare in retaliation for injury to hare.
Man in the moon: dung (ashes) on moon's face smeared there by sun.
Moon wants to marry his sister the sun. She is angered and throws hot ashes on his face.
Sun sister and moon brother. Sun and moon as lovers.
Moon as wooer.
Mark of her mother's hand to be seen on moon's shoulder.
Mark of tiger's paw on moon. India.
Moon spots are tattoo marks.
Cotton tree and nettles on moon.
Spots on moon a banyan tree planted there by creator to diminish its light.
Two children in moon with yoke and bucket.
Woman in the moon.
Man in the moon is an old woman busy with her spindle.
Man in moon is a woman threshing corn with a dog by her side.
Goddess in moon with calabash at her side.
120. Woman in moon's oven seen on clear nights.
Girl with tree carried to moon and is seen there.
Goddess in moon beating tapa beneath tree.
Miscellaneous images on moon. Rows of palm trees (black spots) on the moon.
Bag in the moon.
Giant in moon.
Particular individual is man in the moon.
Joshua as man in the moon.
Jacob as man in the moon.
Other marks on the moon.
Moon as a person.
Moon as wooer. The moon is enamored of a mortal. Sun and moon as lovers. Marriage of a mortal and a god,
Moon abducts woman.
Moon (man) cohabits with woman.
Moon (goddess, woman) cohabits with mortal man.
Moon married to mortal woman.
Moon married to son of sky-god.
Moon is wife to all twelve brothers of the sun and they have her a month at a time because she ate up her sisters.
Moon and mortal have child.
Moon has house.
Moon as person miscellaneous.
Moon deceives sun.
Moon steals from a garden. During day moon stays with his mother under the earth. S. Am.
Moon endowed with wisdom and passion.
Moon kept in box.
Moon buried in pit.
Moon falls into pit but is rescued by man. S. Am.
Causes of moon's phases.
Moon's phases caused by its being put in box. When it is closed up in the box, it is dark; when taken out of the box, light.
Moon's phases caused by watcher's death. Moon is hung in tree and is tended by four men. As one dies it loses a quarter. Later it is united in the lower world.
Moon's waning caused by her sickness.
Sacrifice made to free moon from sickness and allow waxing.
Moon cut in two by sun: hence waxes and wanes.
Moon cut in half.
Moon stolen and divided into quarters.
Moon's phases caused by animals gnawing at edge. S. Am.
Moon's phases caused by feeding or starving. S. Am.
Moon's phases as punishment for moon's misdoing.
Moon's waning caused by menstrual period.
Moon as sun's representative at night.
Moon-boat.
Moon-chariot.
Theft of moon. Moon is kept by a monster. It is stolen and brought to earth. Cf. Theft of the sun. Theft of light. Theft of fire.
Condition and nature of the moon miscellaneous. For eclipse of the moon see A737, where both eclipses of the sun and moon are handled.
Moon has wooden weapons, therefore vulnerable. S. Am.
Sun and moon as divine hero's wedding presents.
3 Why the moon is pale.
Moon is hare covered with silver, which lives in crystal house with fifteen windows. It rests on a chariot and travels around Mount Meru.
Formerly seven moons.
Moon under direct control of deity.
Planet Mars lies on moon to impart warmth to her lest she freeze the earth.
Creation and condition of the stars. Stars as deities. Soul in form of star. Extraordinary behavior of stars.
Stars created by creator.
Star from union of girl with peacock.
Ascent to stars. People or animals ascend to the sky and become stars. Escape to the stars. Fugitives rise in air and become stars.
River taken to sky becomes star. Eridanos.
Chariot from heaven takes couple to live with sages in the Great Bear.
Stars as transformed lovers.
Stars as fires in the hearths of ghosts.
Stars are men peering through holes in sky.
Stars thought of as living beings. S. Am.
Star descends as human being. Shooting star a star that has come down to graze. Shooting stars spirits coming down to earth to make a woman pregnant.
Star-husband. Star takes mortal maiden as wife. Cf.
Mortal marries star-girl.
Stars from objects thrown into sky. Heavenly bodies from objects thrown into sky.
Stars from arrows shot at sky.
Stars hung by god in heavens to decorate it.
Stars as pieces of the moon. Stars made from the old moon.
Stars as children of the moon.
Stars as children of sun eaten by their father. Hence no stars in the day.
Sun eats all his own children except morning star, while moon keeps all her children in hiding.
Stars as children of sun and moon.
Stars as drops of the moon's blood.
Most brilliant stars children of the sun; others are children of the moon.
Stars are transformed spittle of the moon.
Naming the stars.
Origin of constellations. Am. Escape to the stars. Fugitives rise in the air and become stars.
Stars sing together. Music of the spheres.
Creation of the stars miscellaneous.
Stars are trees growing on the clouds.
Stars rebel against God.
Stars supervised by angels.
Speaking stars.
Sun gives light to stars. S. Am.
Origin of particular stars.
Origin of the Great Bear (Ursa Major). Magic song causes tree to rise to sky. Has moon and Great Bear in its branches.
Origin of the Southern Cross. Analogous legends in the southern hemisphere with those of Ursa Major in the northern. Am.
Origin of Orion. Am.
Origin of the Pleiades.
Pleiades a princess and six suitors among whom she could not choose. Rivals in love.
Pleiades six repudiated wives. They have been cast out for apparent infidelity. Persecuted wife.
Pleiades girls who died of grief.
Pleiades seven illegitimate children.
Pleiades from hunters marooned in sky after felling world-tree. S. Am.
Pleiades as swarm of bees. S. Am.
Two stars from Great Bear constellation transferred to Pleiades.

Origin of Hyades.

Origin of constellation Scorpio.

Milky Way is the Wild Hunt. Brunk Zs. Ralston Songs of the Russian People 109; Hungarian: Spolyi Zs. f. deutsche Myth. The Wild Hunt.
Milky Way as a road. S. Am.
Milky Way as path of souls (demons). Am. Rainbow bridge to otherworld.
Milky Way as a river. Blackfoot: De Josselyn de Jong Blackfoot Texts 29ff.
Milky Way as a stitched seam in the sky.
Milky Way as milk from breast of a woman.
Milky Way as the sperma of the gods.
Milky Way as path of a bird of passage.
Milky Way is smoke (ashes).
Milky Way as race track. Calif.
Abyss at end of Milky Way. S. Am.
Origin of stars miscellaneous.
Origin of Coal Sack. S. Am.
Origin of constellation Aquila.
Origin of constellation Argo.
The planets (comets, etc. Graham. Planet Mars lies on moon to impart warmth to her lest she freeze the earth.
Planets supervised by angels.
Origin of Venus (planet). Alexander N. Am. 9; S. Am.
Origin of Morning Star.
Origin of Evening Star.
Origin of Jupiter (planet).
Origin of comets.
Relation of the planets to human life.
Origin of meteors. S. Am.
Falling stars as pieces of the moon. S. Am.
Shooting star one that has come down to graze. Star descends as human being.
Shooting stars spirits coming down to earth to make woman pregnant.
Shooting stars are star-dung.
Shooting stars are unfaithful wives.
The heavenly lights.
Heavenly lights originate from firmament.
Origin of the Rainbow. Treasure at end of rainbow.
Rainbow as bow of deity.
Rainbow as snake.
Rainbow made as bridge by the gods. Rainbow bridge to otherworld.
Rainbow has three colors.
Rainbow is a transformed king; the lesser rainbow is the king's wife.
Rainbow from gods' emptying their drinking cups.
Rainbow is horse of rain-god.
Rainbow comes out of an anthill.
Rainbow lives in a hole. S. Am.
Origin of rainbow: transformed butterflies (souls of lovers).
Rainbow as covenant between creator and men.
Origin of the Northern Lights (Aurora Borealis).
Origin of the signs of the zodiac.
Origin of colors at sunrise and sunset.
-A899. The earth.
Creation of the earth. Mother Earth.
Earth born of Chaos. Primeval chaos.
China first land to appear in our world.
Primeval water: In the beginning everything is covered with water.
God and Devil fly together over primeval water. Conflict of good and evil creators.
Primeval water to subside in a specified time. Calif.
Waters of heaven would engulf earth were it not for firmament.
Earth brought up from bottom of primeval water.
Earth originates from fish brought from bottom of sea. The fish is hacked with knives; hence, mountains. Mountains from hacked-up fish drawn from primeval water.
Earth brought up by three gods.

Earth Diver. From a raft in the primeval sea, the creator sends down animals to try to bring up earth. After a number of animals have failed, one (often the muskrat) succeeds. The earth is made from the bit brought up. **E. W. Count The Earth Diver and the Rival Twins (Proceedings 29th

Devil as Earth Diver. Satan dives for earth at instance of God. Succeeds only third time (by use of right formula). He hides the earth under his tongue. It swells, and he must be rescued by God. Devil as adviser of God.
Earth from egg from bottom of sea recovered by bird. Origin of sky from egg brought from primeval water.
Creator sends crow, after creating her, to scout for earthIndia: Thompson-Balys.
Raft in primeval sea. Creator is on the raft and there creates the earth.
Earth in form of raft supported by spirits. S. Am.
Lotus-leaf raft in primeval sea.
Creator rests on tree or stake. Calif.
Earth from object thrown on primeval water.
Earth from stone thrown on primeval water.
Earth from sand strewn on primeval water.
Earth from decayed matter on primeval water.
Earth from tree grown in primeval water.
Earth from steam made by fire thrown into primeval water.
Earth scattered in a circuit in four directions on primeval water.
Earth from primeval water mixed with seeds of tobacco. Calif.
Earth from lotus seed placed on water.
Earth from egg breaking on primeval water.
Earth from creator's spittle falling on primeval water.
Earth from spittle of primeval potter spreading on surface of water.
Earth from turtle's back. Earth erected on back of a turtle floating in primeval water.
Earth from serpent's head. Earth reared on head of serpent floating in primeval water. Serpent supports the earth. Midgard serpent.
Earth rises from sea.
Stone emerges from primeval water. Devil sits on the stone, which becomes a mountain.
Ocean under this world.
God causes primeval sea to roll back and leave bare all the hills.
Earth let down from sky on to primeval ocean.
Other means of creation of earth.
Earth made of lac.
Earth made by mud shaken from back of primeval boar.
World is transformed mud parrot in golden cage.
Earth made by cups of earth placed on spider's web.
Earth made by transformation of broken ground.
Earth made by first couple dancing on bit of cloth laid on water.
Earth sets like curds.
Earth made by drying up of primeval water.
Earth from worm scratched by creator's nails.
Earth excreted by worm.
Creation of earth by creator. Genesis ch. Creator. Creation of universe by creator.
Earth from body of person (animal).
Earth from body of son of deity.
Earth from giant's body (Ymir).
Earth by sacrifice of son and daughter of first couple.
Earth by murder of first brother and sister.
Earth from the body of murdered child.
Earth from body of slain animal.
Earth from body of divine suicide.
Gods create the earth from their dead victim's blood and bones India: Thompson-Balys.
Earth created from Adam's body.
Creation because of creator's lonesomeness. Dissatisfied at being alone in center of primeval water, God creates the earth.
Earth from creator's cuticle. Goddard PaAM XXIV 7.
Earth from nut in devil's mouth. God throws a nut over his left shoulder. The devil catches it in his mouth. The nut grows rapidly and the devil spits it out. Devil as adviser of God.
Earth created from snow under divine throne.
Creator prepared earth's nucleus as one would a rice cake.
Creator creates earth piecemeal.
Support of the earth.
World-columns. Column to upper world. Island supported on four feet. Otherworld island supported on pedestal.
The four world-columns fastened immovably by two gods with their mother's hairs.
Four world-cords. Earth is suspended from the sky by cords at four corners.
Four maidens as earth-supports. One is at each of the cardinal points.
Twelve iron pillars steady the earth.
Four earth-nails.
Atlas. A man supports the earth on his shoulders. Four gods at world-quarters support the sky. Strong man holds up mountain.
Goddess standing on her head supports earth.
Old woman supports earth on her head.
Earth supported on post. The post has an old woman as guardian. When she is hungry the post shakes, causing earthquakes.
Earth supported on cross of wood. S. Am.
Earth rests on animal's back. Earthquakes from movements of monster.
Earth rests on turtle's back.
Earth supported by bull.
Earth supported by fish.
Earth supported by frog. Earth rests on the horns of a bull who rests upon a fish.
Earth rests on tortoise, serpent, elephant.
Earth rests on elephant's back.
Earth rests on cobra's head.
Earth supported on great boar's tusk.
Earth supported on vast number of birds' legs.
Earth rests on leviathan.
Serpent supports the earth. Earth from serpent's head. Midgard serpent.
Support of the earth miscellaneous.
Earth founded on stone.
Earth rests on God's arm.
Earth supported by prop. S. Am.
Changes in the earth. Raising of the sky. Originally sky is low and is raised to its present place.
How the earth became oblong. God the Father situated on one side of the earth, the Son on the other.
Making the earth smaller. Earth made too large. God learns from devil by trickery how to make it smaller.
Making the earth larger. Gradually extended during creation. See references to A812 in which this idea is always involved.
Doubling size of the earth. Increase of population necessitates change.
Opposite of present. Everything on the earth courses of rivers, height of mountains, human reproduction, etc. are at first the reverse of the present condition. Earlier universe opposite of present.
Hardening of the earth. At first it is soft, but is hardened by sun's rays. Am.
Primeval earth hardened by wind.
Ground, previously all wet, dries up when first woman cuts her little finger and blood drips on ground.
Steadying the earth.
Why earth becomes warm and wet: two huge copper vessels steaming over fire are underneath earth.
Creator's giant servant puts a valley where earth's crust is heavy and a mountain where it is light so as to stabilize it.
— Creator's giant servant puts trees to hold earth together where it slipped.
Roots created to hold land firm.
Nature and condition of the earth.
Earth square with four quarters. Gods of the quarters. Winds of the four quarters established. Four as magic number.
Taprobane at eastern end of the world.
Unextinguishable fire at end of earth.
Four streams from four corners of earth.
Four rivers, rising in paradise, water primitive world.
A671. Four rivers in hell. Four as magic number. The four rivers of paradise. River that flows around the world.
Seven seas encircle the world.
Above and below the earth are great clouds.
Earth wheel-shaped (flat and round).
Navel of the earth. Omphalos, the central point on the earth disc. kgl. Sächs. Ges. d. Wiss. Ges. d. Wiss. Determination of world center. Riddle: what is the center of the earth?
Mountain at center of earth.
Well in the midst of earth from which eleven rivers originate. Boberg.

Midgard Serpent. A serpent surrounds the earth. Dorsey FM IV 13; Aztec: Alexander Lat. Am. Earth from serpent's head. Serpent supports the earth. Thor battles Midgard serpent at end of world. Mythical serpents. Giant serpent.
The leviathan that surrounds the globe. Earthquakes from movements of sea-monster. Mythical serpent.

Earth-tree. Tree of life or fate. *Wünsche "Das Wasser des Lebens in den Märchen der Völker" Zs. f. vgl. Jour. Semitic Langs. World tree. Tree of knowledge forbidden. Magic tree. Tree of life. Tree of life in otherworld. Stream of paradise from roots of world-tree.
F162. The four rivers of paradise.
Other streams from roots of earth-tree.
Three wells under the three roots of earth-tree.
Lake of milk by tree of life.
Animals at earth-tree.

Hart(s) eating of the earth-tree. eating of the earth-tree.
Chattering squirrel in the earth-tree.
Wise eagle in the earth-tree.
Hawk in the earth-tree.
Golden cock in earth-tree. Boberg. Mac
Earth-tree furnishes health-giving and hunger-satisfying sap. Food and drink from magic objects.
Zones of earth corresponding to Zodiac.
Topography -general considerations. Original creator followed by transformers. Transformers.

Topographical features caused by experiences of primitive hero (demigod, deity). d. deutschen Trees bear first buds to commemorate reign of primitive hero. Trees spring up to commemorate birth of primitive hero (demigod, deity).
Topographical changes or landmarks due to battle between gods.
Natural features because of combat of huge rock columns with each other.
Topographical features of the earth arranged by creator.
Two creators go by different route to establish features of the earth. Calif.
Topographical features caused by animals.
Origin of water features
Waters created on first day of creation.
Waters created as punishment.
Bodies of water in primitive abyss sink.
Bodies of water remnant of flood. Deluge.
Waters created by divine twins. Twin gods.
Bodies of water from tears.
Origin of tides. d. deutschen
Tidal wave or surge marks place of death of person. Magic wave. Extraordinary behavior of waves.
Tide caused by breathing of sea-monster.
Ebb-tide goes to great whirlpool.
Tub that drips at high tide but holds water at low tide. Magic tub.
Mountains push water westward. Calif.
Why waters do not engulf the earth.
Quarrel between earth and waters.
Male and female waters.
Origin of the seas.
D2151. Sea produced by magic. Extraordinary occurences concerning seas or waters. Origin of lakes. Magic stone makes rivers and lakes. Lake rises from bramble bush.
Origin of particular lake.
Inexhaustible buckets as source of lakes. Inexhaustible vessel.
Lakes from digging of primeval ox. Lie: hero responsible for topographical features.
Lake bursts forth to drown thief. River bursts from well in pursuit. Extraordinary occurrences connected with lakes. Theft punished. Miraculous drowning as punishment.
Lakes burst forth to commemorate birth, death, battle, etc. Topographical features caused by experiences of primitive hero (demigod, deity). Extraordinary nature phenomena at birth of holy person.
Lakes originate from tears.
Lakes originate from belches. Lake produced by belches after magic draught.
Lake from urine of horse. Lake created by fairies. Fairyland under water.
Lake bursts forth to quell fairy war. War between fairy settlements.
Lake bursts forth to drown impious people. City sinks in the sea. Impiety punished.
Lake from violating tabu. Punishment for breaking tabu. Spring miraculously breaks forth against wrongdoer. Lake rises from bramble bush.
Lake bursts forth where island is plowed out.
Lakes made by giant or devil.
Woman transformed to pool of water. Transformation: woman to pool of water.
Lake bursts forth where blind king plucks rushes. Magic water restores sight. Lake rises from bramble bush.
Lake of milk formed through virtue of saint. Lake of milk created through merit of saint.
Lakes are daughters of the gods.
Origin of the Dead Sea.
Lake originally filled with palm wine.
Origin of sea channels.
Ocean the son of Earth and Heaven.
Ocean made from blood.
Ocean from creator's sweat. Creation by creator.
Ocean from urine.
Miscellaneous origins of the ocean.
Origin of sea from overturned calabash. Alexander Lat.
Origin of sea from rotting snakes.
Sea released from tree-top.
Sea from earth excavation.

Origin of sea's color.
Origin of foul odor of sea.
Origin of fresh water welling up in sea.
Origin of mournful sound of sea.
Origin of surf.
Origin of shining patches beneath sea.
Giant drinks up ocean. Hero's demon guide drinks streams dry on their journey. Task: drinking the sea dry.
Origin of streams. Magic river. Magic object controls river. Magic control of waters. Magic control of rivers. Extraordinary occurences connected with rivers.
Creator of rivers.
Snake as creator of rivers and lakes.
Meander-pursuit. A fugitive's doublings cause a river's windings.
River from urine of goddess (giantess).
River from the slaver of the Fenris-wolf.
River from vagina of first woman.
Various origins of rivers.
Rivers from digging of primeval ox.

Rivers formed where certain stones are placed. Each of seven children are to go in a different direction, to walk a mile and put down a stone, then another mile and a stone, etc. Thus rivers are formed.
Rivers burst forth to commemorate birth, death, battle, etc.
Rivers where god drags his staff.
Rivers originate through saint's prayer during drought. Magic results produced by prayer.
Hail-storm leaves twelve chief rivers in Ireland.
River bursts from well in pursuit. Lake bursts forth to drown thief. Lake from violating tabu. Extraordinary occurences connected with rivers.
Rivers from mythical well.
Stream unexpectedly bursts from side of mountain. Marvelous stream containing little black fish bursts forth from mountain.
Origin of river: from a girl drowned in a well.
River from transformation.
Girl reincarnated as river so god Vishnu can lie in its bed in the form of a stone.
Person transforms self to river.
Goddess in anger breaks herself into five parts: hence, five branches of a river.
Origin of river: transformed flowing honey.
Peacock shows rivers the way to the big valley so they will not go round and round.

Why there is no mist on a certain river: fanned away with a pair of eagle's wings.
Rivers and streams offspring of marriage of Ocean and his sister.

Origin of springs. Magic spring. Magic control of waters. Extraordinary occurrences connected with springs.
Origin of a particular spring.
Springs originate from horse's hoof-prints. Malten Jahrb. d. kaiserlichen deutschen archäologischen Inst. Ipolyi Zs. f. deutsche d. deutschen Aberglaubens s.v.
Spring from urine of horse.
Spring breaks forth where fairy horse lies down. Flood caused by loosing fairy horse and allowing it to stale. Magic horse.
Springs originate from tears.
Spring from striking earth with sword. Spring made by magic. Stroke of staff brings water from rock.
Spring breaks forth where magic spear strikes ground. Magic spear.
Spring where god throws his staff or spear.
Spring breaks forth to commemorate experiences of hero (deity).
Spring breaks forth to commemorate place of death or burial.
Spring breaks forth at primitive hero's need. Gods intervene in battle. Demigods act as allies of mortals. Fairy as helper. God as helper.
Spring breaks forth at need of demigod's warriors.
Spring breaks forth through power of saint. Magic object produces fountain. Miraculous spring (lake) bursts forth for holy person.
Fountain breaks forth through power of Virgin Mary.
Wells break forth at birth of Christ. Nativity of Christ.
Spring breaks forth where saint smites rock. Magic spring. Stroke of staff brings water from rock.
Many-colored fountain breaks forth where saint strikes earth with his foot.

Spring breaks forth through power of saint at place where leper pulls out clump of rushes. Magic cure for leprosy. Rushes uprooted revealing spring. Lake rises from bramble-bush. Miraculous cure for leprosy.
Spring breaks forth where animal delivers book left behind by saint. Animal retrieves lost object.
Spring breaks forth where saint's stolen cow is found.
Cloth from goddess, when spread by holy man over a spot, causes water to spring from earth.

Origin of desert.

Mountains from primeval animal.
Hills from flapping of primeval bird. Hills and valleys are formed from the flapping of a giant turkey-buzzard when the earth is still plastic. Alexander N. Am.

Mountains from hacked-up fish drawn from bottom of primeval water. Earth originates from a fish drawn from the water. It is hacked up and thus made to form mountains. Earth originates from fish brought from bottom of sea.
Mountain from accident to primeval lizard. Lizard passing through a mountain is broken; his fore and hinder parts become mountains.
Mountains spring from scattered parts of slain giant serpent's body.
Mountains (cliffs) from bones of killed giant. Boberg.
Mountains (hills) from ancient activities of god (hero).

Mountains originated from primeval journeys of the first man.

Hills represent loads from culture-hero's shoulders.
Mountains from stones (soil, sand) dropped or thrown.
