Soil dropped to form mountains. Calif.
Mountains and hills from stones thrown by giant at church. d. deutschen
Hills from stones cast by giants. Islands from stones cast by giantess. Giants as builders of great structures.
Hill from anvil (cast by supernatural smith). Smith of the gods.
Hill from sand left by passersby.
Hill as unfinished tower built in the likeness of Nimrod's tower.
Clay soil dropped from sky to form hill.
Mountains (hills) from ancient contest (fight).
Holes in hills result of fight between gods.
Mountains fight each other: cause of their present shape. Wings cut from flying mountains.
Mountains fight each other for honor of being the spot for the revelation.
Battle of demons: hills torn up.
Origin of mountain chain.
One mountain in love with another stretches leg out to meet her: origin of a mountain chain.
Origin of volcanoes.
Origin of mounds.
Mounds from horns cast by cattle. Faithful cattle fight at master's grave until they cast their horns.
Origin of cliffs.
Cliffs become hard. Were formerly soft but become hard by God's order.

Cliff from lovers' leap. Lovers in despair throw themselves from a high place. This becomes a cliff. Baughman. Common among the North American Indians. Tragic love. to be separated. Husband and wife kill themselves so as not
Creation of mountains and hills miscellaneous.
— Mountain from buried giant. Giant ogre.
Cloud on lofty male mountain induced by a beautiful female mountain to bow to her feet: hence their present shape.
Mountains and valleys formed from great fire.
Hills because sky asked earth to wrinkle up its feet.
Water freezes and forms mountains.
Hill brought to country as adopted child.
Origin of mountains as punishment.
Origin of crevasse.
Mountain or hills from actions of the devil.
Origin of rocks and stones. Transformation: man to stone. Rock in sea created by magic. Giant throws a great rock. Remarkable thrower. Extraordinary rocks and stones.
Origin of rocks from breaking of God's sieve.
Indentions on rocks from prints left by man (beast).
Indentions on rocks from imprint of gods and saints. *Toldo Studien zur vgl.
Indentions on rocks from footprints of Christ. Christ on earth.
Priest stamps on stone to prove truth of pope; print is still visible.
Footprints of holy man are still seen in stone where he stood to preach.
Indentions on rocks from footprints of fairies (angels, devils).
Indention on rock from footprint of angel.
The devil's footprint.
Holes in stones caused by piercing by saint's finger. Plummer Vitae Sanctorum Hiberniae clvi.
Holes in stone caused by saint (warrior).
Indentions on rock from weapons (limbs) of robbers through power of saint.
Indentions on rocks from footprints of saint's cow.
Imprint of horse in rocks.
Indentions on rocks from marks of various persons.
Indentions on rocks from head of infant hero (saint).
Chasms between rocks mark "leaps" of giants, heroes, etc. Prodigious jump.
Indentions on rock from paws of King Arthur's dog. Culture hero has marvelous dogs. Culture hero as mighty hunter.
Indentions on rocks from weapons, knees, and elbows (of persons slain by hero).
Rocks or hill-tops flat because persons (gods) slept or cooked on them. Cairn marks burial place.
Hole in stone caused by weapon of warrior.
Indentions on rocks caused by giants. Giants as builders of great structures.
Great fish killed by hero and cut into sixteen pieces: the great stones may still be seen.
Origin of stones: punishment for discourtesy. Jesus asks a man what he is sowing. Jesus turns the crop to stones. This is how stones originate.
Rocks from transformation of people to stone.
Certain stones are druids transformed by power of saint. Transformation: man to stone. Transformation as punishment. Scoffers turned to stone by saint. Saint in conflict with druid.
Certain stones are transformed giants. Graves of giants.
Why stones became hard.
Why stones no longer grow. Devil sows stones; God sends cold to prevent their growing.
Why stones no longer grow: punishment for injuring foot of holy person. Growing rocks. Objects supposed to be born, grow, and die. Boat taken to graze in order to grow.
Why certain rock produces fire when struck with steel.
Fire producing rock result of contest between god of fire and god of rain.
Why rocks at river are covered with moss.
Origin of particular stones or groups of stones.
Giant responsible for certain stones.
Devil throws stones.
Devil and man throw stones in contest.
The devil throws stones at church or churchmen.
Devil throws down quoits when he is told that it is wrong to play on Sunday. They remain as stones to this day.
Devil drops stones.
The devil drops stones from apron.
The devil turns object or animal to stone which is still seen.
Origin of particular rock.
Certain stones are cheeses transformed by saint. Women carrying cheeses concealed pretend that they are carrying webs or balls of thread. Saint changes cheeses to stones.
Pile of stones in certain chapel formed of fragments of salmon transformed by saint. Transformation: man to salmon. Fishermen cut fish into pieces and claim that they have none.
Stone column is membrum virile of ancient hero. Remarkable sexual organs.
Two rocks from split and transformed lapdog.
Origin of minerals. Acquisition of metals.
Origin of minerals from body of dead culture hero. Reincarnation in object.
Iron created to punish cedar's pride.
Origin of emeralds from marvelous vase broken into pieces.
Other stories about stone origins.
Stone rent at time of crucifixion.
Origin of particular places.
Origin of valleys or hollows.
Pillars of Hercules at Gibraltar set up by Hercules.
Bridge of the Gods. A conflict of the gods breaks a primeval bridge and thus causes a rapid in a river (the Columbia River at The Dalles, Oregon).
Cairn marks burial place.
Origin of particular places miscellaneous.
Dark brown patches on soil mark place where marvelous cow (Glas) and her calf lay.
B182. Roads marked out by supernatural cows.
Certain stones are druids' (saints') seats (chairs).
Pile of stones (cairn) marks site of battle.
Other land features.
Origin of villages.
Origin of sacred places.
Origin of sacred post (placed there by ancestral culture hero).
Sacred place where thunderbolt fell down.
Ground bursts open and a temple rises from it.
Five great roads of Ireland "discovered" on night of king's birth. Roads miraculously appear on day of hero's birth.
Origin of cities.
Origin of settlements (places later to be settled).
Origin of boundaries.
Origin of clay.
World catastrophe. The world is destroyed. The incidents are usually the same whether a final destruction is thought of or a destruction which may be overcome by a renewal of the earth. S. Am.
Series of world catastrophes. Am.

Doomsday. Catastrophes precede the Day of Judgment. Alexander N. Am. Cf. Revelations passim. End of world heralded by coming of Antichrist. Birds' wings drip blood when birds hear of Day of Judgment. Prophecy: wholesale slaughter to be inflicted by colossal wheel rolling over Europe. Condemned souls released from hell on Doomsday at request of saint.
Widespread calamity when feast of John the Baptist shall fall on certain day. Feast of Saint John the Baptist.
Signs before the Day of Judgment. End of world heralded by coming of Antichrist. Coming of Antichrist prophesied. Fifteen signs before doomsday.
No rainbow for fifteen years before the Day of Judgment.
Bleeding wood as sign of Doomsday.
Talking stone as sign of Doomsday.
Unusual migration of birds as sign of Doomsday.
Calamity as punishment for sin.
Preservation of life during world calamity.
Preservation of life of certain persons in Ireland during Flood.
Inclosure made during world calamity and only best types of animals and men preserved.
Holy Land not ravaged by deluge.
Renewal of world after world calamity. S. Am. After world catastrophe, new sun appears and starts new epoch.

New race from single pair (or several) after world calamity. Indian: Gayton and Newman 91; S. Am. New race from stones thrown over head after deluge. New race from seeds thrown over head after deluge.
New race from incest after world calamity. Incest.
New race made of red earth after world calamity.
New race from union of girl and rat.
Ireland repopulated by persons who escape flood. Persons excluded from Noah's ark build another ark and sail to Ireland.
Ireland, waste for centuries after flood, is repopulated by immigrants.
Whole tribe descended from lone woman-survivor of doomed city.
One bear-child escapes death, is ancestor of all bears.
After world-fire life recreated from tree.
World calamity will begin in Palestine.
World catastrophes miscellaneous.
First race of men perishes when sun first rises. S. Am.
Animate and inanimate objects attempt to destroy humanity. S. Am.
Large stone falls from sky killing all but one couple. S. Am.

Deluge. Inundation of whole world or section. Religion and Ethics s.v. Am. Am. Lowie ibid. Origin of ocean from flood. Birds cling to sky in flood: cause of tail colors. Fish in deluge deride God: are flattened with blow. Animal characteristics obtained during deluge.
Sun and moon do not shine during deluge.
Great flood lasts eight months.
Local deluges. **Schmarsel Die Sage von der untergegangenen Stadt; *RTP XXVIII 27 and references to earlier volumes. Serpent causes flood.
Flood partially caused by breaking forth of springs. Breaking forth of springs partial cause of flood.
Flood caused by rising of river.
God's promise never to destroy world by water does not apply to local floods.
Flood from fluids of the body.
Flood from tears. Rain from tears. Saint's tears produce fountain.
Flood from Adam's tears of repentance.
Flood from tears of grieving lover. N. Am.
Flood from urine.
Flood caused by loosing fairy horse and allowing it to stale.
Flood from blood.
Flood from slain giant's blood.
Flood from belly. It flows from pierced belly of monster.
Vomiting of a whale causes flood. N. Am.
Flood caused by gods or other superior beings.
Flood from conflict of gods. Sea god and rain god.
Flood from conflict of monsters (giant animals). S. Am.
Spirit causes deluge. S. Am.
Flood caused by deity stamping on floor of heavens.
Pseudo-scientific explanations of the flood. S. Am.
Flood from animals' boring into ground (turtles, crawfishes, etc.
Deluge produced by hot liquid which burns as it floods.
Flood caused by melting of ice after great spell of cold. N. Am.
Flood from broken calabashes of water. Rel. Ethics s.v.
Making mountains out of flat earth causes flood. N. Am.
Moon falls into sea and causes flood by overflowing. S. Am. Hist. Geogr.
Flood whenever shard at earth's core moves.
Flood caused to satisfy emotional need.
Desire of man for sun causes flood. S. Am.
Flood caused by prayer. Magic results produced by prayer.
Flood caused by curse. S. Am. Magic results from curse.
Flood as punishment. Deeds punished. Flood as punishment for murder.
Flood as punishment for breaking tabu.
Flood as punishment for incest. Incest punished. Incest.
Flood brought as revenge for injury.
Deluge
miscellaneous. Subsidence of earth beneath flood.
Serpent king causes flood by damming rivers.
Flood because earth has become too thickly populated.
Flood puts out world-fire. IS. Am.
Escape from deluge.
Deluge: escape in boat (ark). Pelew Is. (These are only a selection of the American Indian references). Unique survivor.
Persons excluded from Noah's ark build another ark and sail to Ireland. Ireland repopulated by persons who escape flood.
Escape from deluge in wooden cask (drum).
Deluge: escape in gourd.
Deluge: escape on floating tree.
Deluge: escape in hollow tree trunk.
Deluge: escape on floating building.

Pairs of animals in ark. Seed of all beings put into ark to escape destruction. Snake preserved in ark: to stop hole with tail. Unicorn thrown from ark and drowned: hence extinct. Griffin disdains to go on ark: drowned: hence extinct. Male rabbit bears young: female rabbit escaped Noah on ark and drowned. Marvelous runner captures two of every wild animal. One bull, one cow survive plague. Task: capturing pair of every wild animal in the land.
Bird scouts sent out from ark. Dove returns to ark in obedience to Noah: rewarded. Raven does not return to ark in obedience to Noah: punished. Bird as messenger. Helpful bird.
Escape from deluge on mountain. N. Am. Am. (Only a selection of references for North and South America.).
Escape from deluge on tree. Am. Tree refuge.
Escape from deluge in cave.
Escape from deluge on island.
Preservation of life of certain persons in Ireland during flood. Ireland repopulated by persons who escape flood.
Escape from deluge on foot.
Rescue from deluge by fish. Fish carries man across water.
Bringing deluge to end.
Trickster sticks spear in ground and leads water to sea, ending deluge. S. Am.
Birds fill sea with dirt and overcome flood. S. Am. Escape from deluge miscellaneous.
Marvelous tree survives deluge.
(Four) persons who, in four quarters of the world, survived the flood and thus preserved ancient tradition.
Escape from deluge in pot or jar. S. Am.
Flood: refuge in huge gourds with seven rooms in each.
Escape from deluge in box or basket.
Survivors of flood establish homes. S. Am.

World-fire. A conflagration destroys the earth. Sometimes (as with the flood legends) the tradition is somewhat local and does not refer to an actual destruction of the whole earth; sometimes the fire marks the end of the world. Am.
Causes of world-fire. General conflagration from violation of tabu.
A "flame of fire swifter than a blast of wind" as punishment for the sin of the Irish.
World-fire after theft of fire. Fire from heaven. Death by fire from heaven as punishment.
Evil demons set world on fire. S. Am.
Fall of sun causes world-fire. S. Am.
All countries burned while the wife of sun god pours fire from a small bowl.
World-fire because of man's arrogance.
Miscellaneous reasons for world-fire. S. Am.
Quenching the world-fire.
Rain invoked to destroy world-fire.
Creator puts out world-fire with his staff.
Earth recreated after world-fire. S. Am.
Men hide from world-fire and renew race. S. Am.
World-fire miscellaneous.
Vulture sent out as scout to see whether earth has cooled from world-fire.
Continuous winter destroys the race. It ushers in the end of the world.
One pair escapes continuous winter and renews race.
Continuous world-eclipse. S. Am.
World-eclipse ended by bat making sun smile.
Heavens break up at end of world.
Behavior of stars at end of world.
Stars fall down at end of world.
End of world when stars in one constellation overtake those in another.
Behavior of sun at end of world.
Sun devoured by monster at end of world.
Sun shining at night as sign of Doomsday.
End of world when four (seven) suns appear in sky.
Behavior of moon at end of world.
Moon shining by day as sign of Doomsday.
Seven days silence in whole universe at the end of the world.
End of world when culture hero removes one of the world-props. S. Am.
Earth-disturbances at end of world. Doomsday.
Earth sinks into sea at end of world.
Earthquakes at the end of the world. S. Am.
Mountains fall together at end of world.
Water-disturbances at end of world.
Sea makes extraordinary noise and throws out fishes at end of world.
Sea water mixes with fresh water at end of the world.
Continuous drought at end of world.
Sun will lock moon in deep ditch in earth's bottom and will eat up stars at end of world.
Extraordinary wind at end of the world.
Sun thrown on fire: period of darkness, rain. Calif.
Flow of molten metal at end of world.

Fettered monster's escape at end of world. Giant, or monster, is fettered in depths of the earth. His movement causes earthquakes. When he succeeds in freeing himself from the fetters and escapes, the world will end. s.v. Earthquakes from movements of subterranean monster. Escapes.
Birth of monsters as sign at end of world.
Fettering of underground monster. Fetter for Fenris wolf. Defeated giants imprisoned in lower world.
Underground monster fettered by trick. Is persuaded to try on fetters.
Forging of chain for fettered monster. Smiths hit once in three or four times on the bare anvil. All of these blows go to forging chains for the monster (devil).
Form of fettered monster.
Fettered monster in human form.
Fettered monster as ferocious animal. S. Am.
Fettered monster as snake.
Fettered monster as dragon. Dragon.
Fettered monster's captivity.
Monster fettered with sword just out of reach. If he reaches it he will free himself.
Fettered monster's vain attempt to reach sword with man's help. Could he reach it he would escape.
Fettered monster questions visitor. He must remain fettered till he hears that nature's laws no longer hold.
Fettered monster preyed upon by vulture. Cf. Prometheus. Punishment of Prometheus.
Fettered monster kept just out of reach of water. The water is always drunk by vulture as he is ready to take it. Punishment of Tantalus. Stands in pool that ever recedes from his lips.
Fettered monster vainly loosens his stake. Each time he loosens it, it is driven in the ground.
Fettered monster's weakened chains renewed by supernatural power. Are almost licked in two by dog but then renewed.
Fettered monster's weakened chains renewed by stroke of a smith.
End of world heralded by coming of Antichrist, a gigantic destructive one-eyed monster. Coming of Antichrist prophecied.
Signs before the birth of Antichrist. Signs before the day of judgment.
Battle at end of world. Armageddon.
Horse shall wade in blood at Armageddon.
Battle of the gods at end of world.
Battle of gods and monster at end of world.
1 Battle of gods and giants at end of world.
Odin battles Fenris Wolf at end of world.
Other gods battle Fenris wolf at end of world.
God battles hound of hell at end of world.
Thor battles Midgard serpent at end of world. Midgard serpent.
End of world to come at disease and death of snake encircling the world.
God battles Leviathan at end of world.
God conquers Satan at end of world.
Battle of saints with Lucifer at end of world. d. Abergl.
Battle of angels with Leviathan and Behemoth at end of world.
Prophecy of defeat in battle as sign of end of the world.
End of the gods. Death of the gods.
Monsters kill each other off at end of world.
World calamities and renewals: miscellaneous motifs.
Natural laws inoperative at end of world.
Three horses from dove's egg on last day.
End of world announced by trumpet.
The Messianic Age.
Extraordinary man at end of the world.
World calamities additional motifs.
World destroyed by rain of stones.
World devoured by ogre.
World turned topsy-turvy and eaten by an earthworm.
Establishment of natural order. Culture hero establishes law and order. Ordering of human life. Mo. Judgments and decrees.

The four ages of the world. A development of the present order through four stages or periods, the golden, silver, bronze, and iron ages, or the like. Religion and Ethics s.v. Series of creations. Hdwb. d. Abergl. III
Golden age. A former age of perfection. Man must labor for a living: at first everything too easy. Prophecy: future golden age.
Reign of peace and justice (under certain king). Good king never retreats in battle. Nature benign and fruitful during reign of good king. Failure of crops during reign of wicked king.
Even trees could speak in golden age.
Former age: spirits and ogres lived with men, and gods appeared in human guise.
Reversal of nature in former age.
Formerly men plowed and cattle were their masters.
Formerly men ate grass: cattle ate rice and pulse.
Formerly men dumb: birds and animals talked.
Formerly men could go safely beneath the sea.
Why powers of nature work on Sabbath.
Nature transformed by God once in seven years.
Establishment of present order: waters.

Impounded water. Water is kept by monster so that mankind cannot use it. A hero defeats the monster and releases the water. (The monster is sometimes a giant frog.) Am. Person sacrificed to water-spirit to secure water supply. God of water. Culture hero overcomes monsters. game released. Evil spirit holds back water. Princess stands in middle of dried up tank so serpent will release the water which he had swallowed up completely. Evil spirit drinks water supply dry.
God promises never again to destroy world by water. Escape from deluge.
Why the sea is salt.
Why the sea is salt: because of wrecked salt ship. Thief loses his goods or is detected.

Why the sea is salt: magic salt mill. Stolen by sea-captain, who takes it aboard and orders it to grind. It will stop only for its master; ship sinks and mill keeps grinding salt. Continuous action started by breaking tabu. Magic mill. Magic object obeys master alone.
Why the sea is salt: heavy rain showers on ashes of wood burnt by primeval fire. S. Am.
Origin of sea-waves.
Sea-waves are (manes of) sea-god's horses.
Origin of foam on waters.
Origin of swirling motion of water. Animals and birds scratch in it.
Establishment of present order: waters
Why sea is blue. miscellaneous.
Why sea waters are warm: kept so by Leviathan.
Origin of sea's unpleasant odor.
Establishment of present order: winds. Bag of winds. Magic wind. Magic object controls wind. Wind produced by magic.
Breathing of deity (spirit) causes winds.
Cave of winds. Winds originally confined in caves. Culture hero tames winds in caves. Wind continually blows from cave.
Hole of winds: stopper destroyed. The hole is stopped with a wooden stopper, which is destroyed. The country dries up.
Wind a bird dwelling in mountain-hole.
Lost wind found in hollow tree: has been banished and is needed by men.
Wind comes through holes in sky when gut covering is cut.
Winds as children of titans (giants).
Winds caused by flapping wings. A giant bird causes the wind with his wings. The wings are cut by the culture hero so that the bird cannot flap so hard. Giant birds.
Wind caused by flapping of ears of giant. Peigan: Uhlenbeck Verhandelingen der Koninklijke Akademie van Wetenshappen XIII (1) 64.
Wind caused by wind-god's wind lies down, the wind blows. movements. When the son of the Bushman: Bleek and Lloyd 101ff.
Winds of the four quarters established.
A417. Gods of the Quarters. Earth square with four quarters. Determination of world quarters. Effect of the four winds on weather.
North wind tempers fury of south wind.
South wind causes heat and hurricanes.
Gentle west wind said to be exhausted from fleeing deity.
Regulation of winds.
Angels' wings protect earth from winds! Jewish: Neuman.
When wind-spirit is awake it storms; asleep, it is calm.
Establishment of present order: winds miscellaneous.
Colors of winds.
Creator establishes twelve winds, each a different color.
Origin of monsoon: from chewed skin and spit of pair of divine friends eating guavas.
Wind is blind.
Establishment of present order: weather phenomena.
A1127. Magic weather phenomena. Magic object controls elements. Magic control of the elements. Angels set over clouds, winds, and rains. Origin of storms in sixth heaven. Series of upper worlds.
Origin of rain.
ham. Regulation of rains. Why it rains most in the hills.
Rain from tears. Flood from tears.
Rain from urine.
Rainy weather sent by saint as punishment.
Rain from sea in upper world.
Rain from container in sky.
Rain kept in waterskin dragged along sky floor.
Rain from rain-god (rain spirit).
Rain shed by stars.
Origin of dew. Knoop Zs. f. Vksk.
Origin of clouds.
Origin of clouds from Ymir's brain.
Origin of clouds: creator ornaments the sky with clouds so that the mountains are sometimes shaded.
Clouds as smoke rising to sky. S. Am.
Clouds as God's shield.
Origin of mist (fog).
Origin of wintry weather.
Origin of cold in winter.
Origin of cold: sun turns fiery face upward.
Origin of snow.
Snow from feathers or clothes of a witch (Frau Holle). Devil's grandmother is bleaching when it snows.
Origin of frost. S. Am.
Origin of hail. S. Am.
Causes of hot weather: God bores hole in hell.
Origin of lightning.
Lightning as fiery snake. Lightning made from the old moon.
Lightning from flashing sword.
Lightning from heavenly horses striking hoofs against stars.
Lightning as god's whip.
Lightning as God's messenger.
Lightning produced by deity.
Lightning from fire. S. Am.
Lightning as torches of invisible dancers.
Origin of lightning other motifs. S. Am.
Origin of thunder. God of thunder.
Origin of thunderbolt.
Creator's (deity's) voice makes thunder.
Thunder from flying dragon. Dragon.
Persons escape to sky and become thunder. Calif. Ascent to stars.
Origin of thunder clouds: from wings of mountains.
Thunder is sound of God's gun.
Thunder caused by God beating his weapon, India: Thompson-Balys.
Thunder from crashing of stones in moon as goddess beats tapa.
Thunder from thunder-spirit beating his children. S. Am.

Cause of thunder: sounds of the horses' hoofs as gods play ball. Thunder from clashing weapons of warring spirits in sky. S. Am. Thunder from deity separating the winds which try to unite. Thunder is noise of waterskin which rain-god drags along sky floor. Thunder made by giants in sky. Thunder the drums of dead.
Cause of earthquakes.
Earthquakes from movements of subterranean monster. S. Am. Earth supported on post. Cause of earthquakes. Fettered monster. In depths of earth: movement causes earthquakes,
Earthquakes from movements of sea-monster. The Leviathan that surrounds the globe. Leviathan causes cataclysm by striking earth with tail.
Origin of stormy sky.
Origin of red sky (blood).
Origin of tornado sunsets; i. Origin of tornado sunsets; i. e., peculiar sunsets foreboding tornadoes.
Determination of seasons. Magic control of seasons.
Establishment of times for sowing and reaping.
Theft of the seasons. Certain seasons are lacking. A culture hero steals the season from a monster and brings it to his people.
Boneless man turned over to produce seasons. Sex tabu broken: child born without bones. Person with gristle instead of bones.
Seasons produced by marriage of North and South.
Genealogy of summer and winter. Boberg.
Why days lengthen in spring.
Why days shorten in autumn: the real sun sets very early because the red cockscomb plant, used to kill his brother sun with, grows to its full height during this time.
Causes of seasons deities push sun back and forth at solstices.
Determination of the months. February's shortage of days. Days stolen by January and March.
Origin of night and day. Theft of light. Animal calls the dawn. Magic control of day and night. Chanticleer believes that his crowing makes the sun rise.
Origin of day.
Opening of creator's eyes creates day.
Windows in firmament shed light. Windows in heaven. Magic light.
Angels of the day: Jewish: Neuman.
Origin of day: son of the night and the dawn.
Determination of night and day. After much discussion, the relative length of these divisions is determined.
Regulation of sunshine.
Wallet containing night and day. Man who asks for good weather given a box full of hornets. He thinks it is filled with the weather.
Night and day have steeds and chase each other.
Origin of night.
Night (darkness) in package. Released. Alexander Lat. Bag of winds.
Why some nights are dark and some light.
Purchase of night. Originally no night. Culture hero goes to distant land and buys it. He introduces sleep, etc. Cock to crow for day. Sun and moon kept in pots. Theft of sun.
Night stolen and kept in jar. S. Am.
Night caused by deity wrapping himself in dark mantle.
Why sun shines on Saturday (Friday).
Origin of “yesterday” and “today.
Origin of night and day miscellaneous.
Origin of twilight.
Twilight reflection of fires of hell.
Origin of dawn.
Dawn reflection of roses of paradise.
Establishment of present order -miscellaneous motifs.
Determination of world center. By reaching to its ends. Riddle: what is the center of the earth.
Determination of world quarters. The four cardinal points. Gods of the Quarters. Earth square with four quarters. Winds of the four quarters established.
Wings cut from flying mountains. In beginning mountains have wings. They are cut off by thunderbolt.
A969. Mountains fight each other: cause of their present shape. Extraordinary mountains and valleys. Measuring the world.
Creator appoints a chief for each class of created things: Lucifer for demons, Sion for mountains, etc.
All things receive names.
Origin of echo.
Why salt disappeared from forests. S. Am. CREATION AND ORDERING OF HUMAN LIFE Creation of man.
Man created to rule the earth.
Unacceptable gods as first inhabitants of earth.
Creation of man by creator. Creator. God makes automata and vivifies them. Negroes made from left-over scraps at creation. Fierce flesheating creatures made by creator in fit of anger.
Man made from creator's body. Universe from parts of creator's body.
Man springs into existence from deity's body by his mere thinking. New
Man from dirt mixed with creator's blood. Eitrem Opferritus und Voropfer der Griechen und Römer (Skrifter Akad. Dixon 107 (figures drawn on ground and sprinkled with creator's blood).
Man from sweat of creator.
A114. Goddess born from sweat of rock washed by sea. Man created from sweat. Man from spittle of creator.
Being made from spittle of the gods. Spitting of all parties into vessel to seal bargain.
Man made from creator's eye.
Man made from dirt rubbed from creator's (hero's) body.
Man made from broken off toenail of creator. S. Am.
Primeval human pair spring from two drops of urine of creator (woman from half-drop).
First man the result of maid having licked semen-stained loin cloth of creator's teacher.
Primeval crab pulls first five living creatures out of his side.
Man created in creator's image.
Man originates from god who comes to earth. Man as offspring of creator. First parents children of god. Creator makes woman and then begets man by her.
Mankind from masturbation of creator with earth. Mother Earth.

Devil's unsuccessful attempt to vivify his creations as God has done. Succeeds only in making animal. Devil as maplot at creation. Deity provides man with soul. Origin of death from unsuccessful imitation of bad creator.
Rebel angels oppose creation of man.
Man created by co-operation of the gods.
Creation of man through evolution. Spontaneous creation: evolutionary type.
Progressive degeneration to present race of men.
Mankind from unusual primeval mating.
Mankind begotten by giant's two feet. He touches one foot with the other and begets progeny.
Mankind from "Peace and Quiet fructified by Light. Mankind from "Peace and Quiet fructified by Light."
Mankind from mating of pairs of reeds.
Mankind from mating of tree and vine.
Mankind from mating of frog and “daughter of fire. Mankind from mating of frog and “daughter of fire."
Mankind from human-animal mating. Marriage of person to animal. Mankind originates from eggs. Cosmic egg. Man created from egg formed from sea-foam.

Confusion of tongues partly due to lack of understanding of difference between the word for "stick" and the word for "stone. Confusion of tongues partly due to lack of understanding of difference between the word for "stick" and the word for "stone."

Origin of death from bad creator's unsuccessful imitation. The bad creator attempts in vain to endow his creations with life like the good creator. Fails and thus introduces death. Devil as marplot at creation. Devil's unsuccessful attempt to vivify his creations. Foolish imitation.

Origin of death from unwise choice. Choice between two bundles, one containing tempting articles, the other everlasting life. People choose the large bundle and lose everlasting life. Modest choice: three caskets type.
Origin of death when early people put on new skins. Child fails to recognize mother, who puts old skin back on.

Bad women from transformed hog and goose. Peter, having only one daughter, foolishly promises her to three men. He asks the Lord to create two others. This request is granted. The various children of Eve. Eve has so many children that she is ashamed when God pays her a visit. She hides some of them and they fail to receive the blessing that God gives those in sight. Origin of insects: released from sack. God places them in a sack and gives it to hare to carry to stream. He must not look in the sack. When he does so the insects escape. The hare laughs and this is the cause of his split lip. Why hare's lip is split. Tabu: looking into bag.
Insects from devil's post-hole. Devil is given enough land to dig a post-hole. From this come all kinds of insects. To stop them a burning log is put in the hole. Insects therefore hate smoke.

Animal characteristics: change in ancient animal. Animal elders. Mythical ancestors of the present animals.
Animal characteristics: accidental action of ancient animal.
Lynx views country from mountainside: cause of his squint.
Rabbit laughs: cause of hare-lip.
Wolf falls out of nest: cause of straight back.
Why some whales die on land: first whale did so.
Shrew blows nose into snout. Sent after fire, he finds but a little which he tries to revive by hard blowing.
Spider carries large stone on head and drops it: hence spiders under stones.
Birds cling to sky in flood: cause of tail colors. N. Am. Animal characteristics obtained during deluge.
Lizard dips head in palm-oil: cause of red head.
Lizard swallows fish bone: hence head bobs up and down.
Tortoise left out in rain: hard shell develops.
How rattlesnake became harmful: earthworm feeds him chili pepper. S. Am.
Buffalo helps tiger quench fire: white mark left on buffalo's neck where tiger held on while being ducked in water. Markings of mammals.
Stag defeated by snail vomits his gall-bladder.
Rat defecates on octopus's head: origin of tubercles on head.
Goddess scatters pubic hairs on fish: why he has so many bones.
Animal characteristics from great fear.
Frightened rabbit puts head in charred tree: hence black ears.
Frightened animals scatter: cause of present habitat of each.
Animal characteristics from squeezing or stretching ancient animal (See A2231.
Ancient animal squeezed: hence small size.
Animal pressed: hence facial or bodily marks.
Wildcat's (Lynx's) face mashed in. N. Am.
Tortoise pressed into earth: hence humpy back.
Baboon pressed on hot, flat rock: hence bald place on his back.
Why lobster is shallow: insulted cattle step on it.
Animals' size increased by stretching. 4. Animal characteristics changed by stretching.
Coyote's muzzle pulled out long.
Fox's tail pulled out long.
Mouse's nose pulled out long. Salinan: Mason U. Cal.
Animal characteristics from being struck.
Mole struck on head in attempt to steal fire: hence his flat head. S. Am.
Fish struck by coconut: hence flat tail.
Animal characteristics from dropping ancient animal from air.
Swallow thrown on his tail: cause of split tail.
Ant thrown from heaven: hence narrow waist. God decides dispute between ant and spider in spider's favor.
Unicorn thrown from ark and drowned; hence no longer exists. Animal characteristics obtained during deluge. Unicorn.
Crab thrown to ground: breaks into small pieces. Hence crabs are small.
Tortoise hurled on rock: half falls on land, half in water. Therefore amphibious. Haunts of reptiles, etc.
Tortoise dropped by eagle: hence cracks in his shell. Tortoise lets self be carried by eagle. Dropped and eaten. Borrowed feathers. Dupe lets himself be carried aloft by bird and dropped.
Bat falls from high perch due to extreme heat of sun's rays, breaks bones, etc. Hence peculiar feet and nose.
Animal characteristics from throwing members at ancient animal.
Stick (leaf) thrown at animal's rump: hence tails.
Hare runs away at creation; almost loses tail. When, as the most timid of all beasts, he runs away, God throws a tail at him from a pile of tails.
Bowl placed on turtle's back: hence his shell.
Red fruit thrown at rail's (bird's) head: hence red lump on head.
Fox struck with churn-dash: hence white tail. Cf.
God throws diver's feet after him; hence his feet reach backward.
Animal characteristics: members bitten or cut off.
Bear fishes through ice with tail: hence lacks tail. The tail fisher.
Devil pulls off goats' tails: hence lack tails.
Moon splits hare's lip with hatchet: hence hare-lip.
Bush-rat bites off tortoise's tail: hence tortoise's short tail.
Hawk's tail cut in two by sword as he is being transformed. Cause of his forked tail.
God as falcon has tail cut off: hence falcon's short tail.
Formerly animals have ears like elephant's: hare bites them off.
Appearance of animal from marking or painting.
Birds painted their present colors.
Chipmunk's back scratched: hence his stripes. As he is trying to escape, bear catches him with his claws and marks him permanently.
Marks on certain fish from fingerprints.
Marks on certain fish from St. Marks on certain fish from St. Peter's fingerprints.
Marks on certain fish from devil's fingerprints.
Animal characteristics from burning or singeing. Dh III
Raven caught in smoke-hole: hence is black.
Animal scorches self while putting out fire in land of fire, woe and darkness.
Jackal carries sun in bag on back; burns his back black.
Animal who steals fire scorched: cause of his color.
Coyote burnt when hay is set afire: hence yellow patch behind his ears. Salinan: Mason U. Cal.
Robin steals fire, has breast scorched.
Raven singes feet on hot stones: why its wings clap when it flies.
Rabbit burns self under chin when he steals an ember. S. Am.
Eel burned by torch: hence red eyes.
Other accidents to ancient animal.
Animal has color spilled on him: cause of his color.
Cow swallows book; cause of maniplies in stomach.
Only one serpent had sting: fed poison to the rest. Why snakes are venomous.
Animal characteristics as reward.
Hedgehog's skin reward for good deed.
Animal characteristics reward for pious act. Jesus causes animal characteristics. Religious animals. Piety rewarded. V. Religion.
Animals blessed for honoring infant Jesus. The Nativity of Christ.
Animals blessed for good services at crucifixion. The Crucifixion.
Flies on Christ's body rewarded. They look like nails and prevent more nails being driven. They may eat at the king's table. Helpful fly.
Blood from cross on robin redbreast: He helps Jesus; rewarIded with red breast.
Blood of scourged Christ on certain spiders.
Swallows lift Christ's crown of thorns from his brow: why their nests are not destroyed. Immunity from disaster as reward.
Swallows put on mourning at crucifixion: have never taken it off.
Crossbill, attempting to draw thorn from the crown of thorns, twists bill in the attempt.
Markings on animals as recollections of Christ's life and sufferings. Ant collects incense and myrrh for Christ: grows thin in middle. Origin of flounder from Virgin Mary's half-eaten fish.
Animal blessed for helping holy fugitive. Helpful spider. Spider-web over hole saves fugitive. Flights.
Ox helps patriarch who in joy kisses him on the lips: hence no hair on ox's lips.
Animal blessed for obedience to deity.
Bird coloring as reward for obedience to deity. Origin of color of bird.
Dove returns to ark in obedience to Noah: receives sheen of raven.
A1021. Bird scouts sent out from Ark. Squirrel's markings and immunity from falling as reward by deity. Markings of mammals. Animal's gait or walk mammals.
Why sheep walk with bowed heads: they have remained so after having bowed to God.
A2441. Cause of sheep's walk. Sheep helpful to the Lord: get wool. Deity rewards animal for bringing him water: cause of present characteristics.
Animal characteristics reward for hospitality. Why sparrow may build nest near people's houses: reward for hospitality. Hospitality rewarded.
Thrush's hospitality to peacock rewarded by being given motley coat of feathers.
Animal characteristics reward for helpfulness.
Cat helps man build house: may occupy chimney corner.
2, A2433. African
Bird carries deity (his daughter) home from land of skulls: given brilliant plumage. Land of skulls.
Mouse gathers rice for man: may eat a little of his rice daily.
A2435. Food of animal. Pike helps Christ cross stream: made king of fishes. King of fishes.
Dog guards master's life and wealth: may eat before other animals. Why dog eats first.
Tortoise given hard shell when it ferries rice-goddess across stream. Origin of tortoise's shell.
Ravens show Adam how to bury dead: are born with white feathers.
Chameleon saves hero's life: may change color.
Animal characteristics as reward
miscellaneous. Dog rescues cow's teats from fire: origin of his black muzzle.
Dog lets devil into church to steal: rewarded with dog-skin.
Owl will not betray curate: therefore may live in steeple.
Fly steals fire from spider: may eat everywhere. Spider brings fire from hell. Fly steals it from him on the way.
Cuckoo delivers other birds from their cruel king: they agree to hatch out cuckoo's young. Why cuckoo has no nest.
Bird has red spot on its tail as reward for having moved woman's organ to its present position. Misplaced genitalia. Origin of color of animal's tail.
Animal characteristics as punishment.
Animal characteristics: punishment for impiety. Jesus causes animal characteristics. Religious animals. Tabu: rudeness to sacred person or thing. Curses. Impiety punished. V. Religion.
Animal characteristics: punishment for discourteous answer to God (saint).
Discourteous answer: why cow (horse) is always eating. Beggar is refused request.

Discourteous answer: flounder's crooked mouth. When God asks him where he is going, instead of answering he turns to go toward God. His mouth becomes crooked. Flounder complains in race: crooked mouth.
Discourteous answer: why crab has eyes behind.
Discourteous answer: tortoise's shell. Zeus celebrates a wedding and invites the animals. Tortoise is late.
Animal characteristics: punishment for hostility at crucifixion. Why weavers are the most unhappy of men. They gave a nail for the crucifixion. Punishment for opposition to Christ at crucifixion.
Crane will not weep at crucifixion: must suffer thirst in August and break bills. Is the only bird who will not weep. Only one person refuses to weep at hero's death.
Swallows torment Christ on cross: lose voice.
Animal characteristics: punishment for working on holy day. Tabu: breaking the Sabbath.
Cuckoo builds nest on Annunciation Day: has no nest. (Cf. Dh II 6.
Bees work on Sabbath: may not get honey from red clover.
Frog fails to honor infant Jesus: loses tail.
Spider vies with Virgin Mary in spinning: cursed. Arachne transformed to spider. Vies with goddess in spinning.
Spider steals thread from Christ: has thread in back of body.
Animal harmful to holy person cursed. Adder harmful to holy person transformed to blindworm. Punishment for opposition to holy person.
Animal cursed for betraying holy fugitive.
Beetle cursed for betraying Holy Family on way to Egypt; beetle now has its eyes always on the ground.
Animal cursed for refusing to carry holy fugitive across stream.
Tortoise cursed for going under water while ferrying ricegoddess: people will be able to kill it with iron-made spears.
Toad refuses to weep over its dead children: dries up when dead. Cursed by Virgin Mary.
Fish in deluge deride God: are flattened with blow. They mock God for his powerlessness over them.

Crab beats deity's forbidden drum: eyes lift out of body. Creation of animals as punishment for beating forbidden drum. CO. Tabu: contact with supernatural. Animals produced when forbidden drum is beaten.
11 Beetle demands return of gold from God: must hum. In his overweening pride he hits fence and ever afterward has hummed. Dh.
Buffaloes fail to come at god's leavetaking: now are killed by tigers.
Loris refuse to look at sun who comes out when they are dancing: hence never looks at sun.

Animal characteristics: punishment for immoderate request. Dissatisfied animal finds that when his request is granted he is worse off than before. Overweening ambition punished. nished. Dissatisfaction. Camel asks for horns: punishment, short ears.
J950. Presumption of the lowly. Pride brought low. Bees pray for sting: punishment, first sting suicidal.

Beetle makes immoderate request; ant moderate: inverse awards. Creator hears wishes of animals. Beetle wants strong, noble appearance. Ant is modest. Beetle punished by being made to creep on ground. Ant is given own castle.
Griffin disdains to go on ark; drowned: hence extinct. Animal characteristics obtained during deluge. Griffin.
Animals ask for goddess's perfume: punishment, bad odor.
Birds who aspire to blackbird's coat punished.
Peacock given ugly feet so as to prevent too great arrogance.
Dog's embassy to Zeus chased forth; dogs seek ambassador: why dogs sniff each other under leg. Presumption of the lowly. Pride brought low. Zeus has embassy of dogs imprisoned for fouling his court.
Ants ask God to give them wings: wind blows them away.
Raven attempts to imitate dove: punished with awkward gait.
Donkeys ask immediate reward from God: eat their own excrements.
Animal characteristics: punishment for laziness. S. Am. Laziness punished.
Animals refuse to help dig well (make road) and are punished.
Animals refuse to help dig well: may not drink from river or spring.
Snake refuses to help make road: dies on road.
Shrew refuses to help make road: dies on road.
Sloth refuses to help make road: may not look upon sun.
Dog will not help build house: must remain out of doors.
Too cold for hare (dog) to build house in winter, not necessary in summer: must go without house. Does not need roof when it is fair, cannot put it on when it rains.
Owl as watchman goes to sleep: does not see by day. He is placed as watchman of wren who is imprisoned in a mousehole.
Grasshopper builds no house for winter; ant strikes him blind: therefore born blind.
Bird neglects to build nest: goes without.
Animal characteristics: punishment for disobedience. Dh. Tabu: rudeness to sacred person or thing. Curses. Impiety punished. Disobedience punished.
Raven does not return to Noah: must suffer thirst and break bill. Variant: he is cursed to be black or to eat carrion. Bird scouts sent out from ark. obtained during deluge. Animal characteristics
Raven does not return to ark in obedience to Noah: black color is resulting punishment. Dove returns to ark in obedience to Noah: receives sheen of raven.
Animals eat deity's forbidden fruit: punished. Forbidden fruit.
Lemur looks where forbidden: has big eyes. Looking tabu.
Hare weeps for mother when forbidden: moon hits him and cleaves lip. Tabu: too much weeping for dead.
Animal characteristics caused by animal's lateness at distribution of qualities.
Animal characteristics: punishment for planning man's downfall.

What creature has sweetest blood: gnat's tongue torn out. Assembly to decide who has the sweetest blood so that it may be the food for the serpent. Gnat discovers that man has the sweetest blood. Rather than let him tell this secret, swallow tears out his tongue. Gnat can only buzz. Blood of certain animal said to be sweet.
Animal characteristics: punishment for carrying devil into paradise. Paradise lost.
Snake carries devil into paradise: loses feet.
Peacock has snake carry devil into paradise: cursed with ugly voice and feet.
Animal punished for not warning of devil's temptation in Eden.
Magpie tells man he is to die next day: no tongue and long tail. God pulls out his tongue and makes his tail long for doing this forbidden thing.
Animal punished for not heralding dawn.
Nit tries to bore through man's head: must remain at edge of hair.
Jay carries sulphur to devil in hell: must be quiet at noon.
Cat commanded to pray so as not to slay man: why cat purrs.
Animal characteristics punishment for meddling. Meddling punished.

Animal reveals mistress's adultery: punished by master. Bird reveals woman's infidelity. Dog betrays woman's infidelity. Cocks who crow about mistress's infidelity killed. Discreet cock saves his life. Fool discloses woman's adultery: lover kills him. Adultery punished. Faithlessness in marriage.
Animal characteristics: punishment for greed. Spider transformed for greediness: now occupies dark corners. Avarice punished.
Rabbit (frog) eats seed-grain from fields: nose closed during sowing season.
Ring-dove eats man's grain: man may kill him. Similarly francolin and guinea fowl.
Fish eat other fish: guilty must swim deep.
Diver eats nests of small birds: must not nest away from water.
Animal characteristics from miscellaneous punishments.
Hare punished for perjury: eyes deep in head.
Fly punished for failing to answer question: is speechless, buzzes and associates with foul things.
Ass betrays deity's secret: hence his ugly bray.
Owl reveals deity's secret: power of speech removed.
Woodpecker punished for stinginess.
Animals punished for assaulting women.
Ass has cross on shoulders from being struck by Balaam.
Crocodile is punished for trying to attack man he is carrying: has only half tongue.
Animal punished for hardheadedness (frog toothless, mole sightless).
Why mouse is crushed whenever she crosses a road: elephant's curse.
Why elephant hurts himself when running through the grass: mouse's curse.
Animal characteristics: obtaining another's qualities. Dove returns to Ark in obedience to Noah: receives sheen of raven.

Animal characteristics: borrowing and not returning. Animal borrows a member (or quality) from another and refuses to return it. Other deceptions in the payment of debt. Refusal to return borrowed goods. Thief borrows cloak so as to carry food, Disappears with it.
Stag's horns borrowed from dog. Dh.
Owl's wings borrowed from rat (or other animal).
Partridge's voice borrowed from tortoise.
Cuckoo borrows food from other birds.

Nightingale borrows blindworm's eye. Each has one eye. Nightingale borrow's blindworm's and will not return it. Japanese: Ikeda; English: Shakespeare Romeo and Juliet III v. 31. Substituted eyes. Lost eyes are replaced by those of another person or animal.
Jay borrows cuckoo's skin.
Squirrel borrows coney's tail. When coney's tail is not returned, he goes in shame to live among rocks.
Boy borrows python's hands and feet: hence python lacks them.
Hornbill borrows tomtit's bill.
Beaver borrows muskrat's tail and never gives it back.
Monkey borrows tail from deer and refuses to return it.
Animal characteristics: obtaining for feast and not returning.
Animal characteristics: lending and refusing to receive back.
Spider hands box to ant and refuses to take it back: hence ants carry huge loads.
Animal characteristics: stolen from another animal.
Thrush steals woodcock's song.
Animal characteristics: exchange of qualities. Plant characteristics from exchange of qualities.
Buffalo and cow exchange hides: hence bad fitting hides.
Snake and turtle exhange head for fangs. Explains snake's fangs and snake-like head of turtle.
Rhinoceros exchanges his red hide for hippopotamus's black.
Dove and magpie exchange eggs two: why dove has two eggs. Toad trades his tail for mole's eyes.
Beaver and muskrat exchange tails.
Animal characteristics: result of contest.
Cock and ptarmigan in contest: winner to live in town.
Man and tiger in contest: winner to live in town.
Lizard wins contest with toad: why snakes and lizards change their skins.
Animal characteristics from contest in carrying.
Ant carries load as heavy as himself. Various explanations.
Animal characteristics determined by race.
Race of animals to see where each shall live.
Race of ox and horse: ox must labor. Horse wins and ox must serve as draft animal.
Race of culture hero with ostrich: ostrich loses beautiful feathers.
Flounder complains in race: crooked mouth. In race between fish he cries out in jealousy because herring is winning. He is punished with crooked mouth.
Animal characteristics from jumping contest.
Dog burned in jumping contest over fire: enmity between dog and hare.
Bird characteristics from flying contests. Wren king of birds. Wins contest for kingship.
Animal characteristics result of lawsuit.
Wool on his forehead awarded sheep in lawsuit. He is given the privilege of keeping it when the rest of his body is shorn.

Lizard loses lawsuit: must bob his head. Lizard and ant accused of theft of king's crow. Ant pours boiling water down lizard's  throat. When case is tried, lizard cannot talk but only bobs head up and down. Adjudged guilty and condemned to bob his head eternally.
Animal characteristics from contest in watching. Contest in seeing sunrise first.
Hare and man contest in watching for leaf to fall off tree. First one to succeed may eat other. Hare loses.
Animal characteristics from duel.
Why tiger does not attack wild boar until latter is old: result of duel. Boar to duel with tiger cakes mud on body; defeats tiger.
Animal characteristics: as a result of quarrel.
Animal characteristics from transformation.
Animal characteristics from transformation of animal. Animal cries reminiscent of former life as man.
Shepherd transformed to bird still calls sheep: explanation of bird cries. Usually told of hoopoe and bittern.
Spider transformed for greediness: now occupies dark corners.
Catfish transformed from woman still carries women's tatoo marks.
Catfish transformed from children still carry marks of children's knife holder.
Woodpecker transformed from stingy woman: therefore stingy.
Weeping man turned into owl; still bewails sorrows.
Snipe messenger for warriors because he was a messenger when a man.
Animal characteristics from transformation of implement (or other object).
Horse originally had eyes on feet: put out and became eyelike marks.
Pegs driven into backs of baboons become tails.
Serpent steals from God's coat a stick for his back.
Animal characteristics from miscellaneous causes.
Animal characteristics learned from another animal,
Thrush teaches dove to build nest.
Sparrow taught to sing by lark but not sufficiently: where sparrow got voice.
Animal characteristics: imitation of other animal or object.
Animal cries: imitation of sounds.
Nightingale hears boy call oxen: learns her song.
Cricket hears water hiss on hot iron: learns his song.
Garden warbler hears smith beat iron: learns his song.
Lizard's tail imitated from snake's.
Animal habit a reminiscence of former experience.
Animal cries a lament for person lost when animal was transformed.
Animal cries a lament over animal's transformation.
Animal cries reminiscent of former life as man. Reincarnation: former lives remembered.
Animal cries recall ancient adventure. The ancient animal cries out in difficulty. The present animal has the same cry.
Green pigeon cheated out of its chick: is always mourning.
Animal's seeking attitude from ancient loss. The ancient animal loses something. Its descendants are forever seeking for the lost object. This explains the characteristic bearing of certain animals.
Hog loses pancake in mud: still seeks it.
Hawk (vulture) loses grandmother: still hovers and seeks her.

Bat, diver, and thornbush shipwrecked. Bat brought money, bush put on clothes, and diver brought leather. All shipwrecked. Diver is looking for his leather. Bush looks for his clothers and holds fast to all passers-by. Bat is abroad only at night to escape creditors.

Dolphins seek King Solomon's ring. He loses his magic ring in the sea. They are sent by God to get it. This is why they go up and down in the sea. Fish recovers ring from sea. Solomon's power to hold kingdom dependent on ring: drops in water. Task: recovering lost ring from the sea. Lost ring found in fish.
Dog loses his patent right; seeks it: why dogs look at one another under the tail.
Son accidentally kills father, who returns to life as cuckoo and tells people when to sow grain.
Enmity between animals from original quarrel.
Cat loses dog's certificate: enmity between cats and dogs. Dog is given a certificate of nobility. Through cat's carelessness it is lost.
Cat garbles message from man to tiger: enmity between man and tiger. Origin of death from falsified message.
Quarrel of dog and cat about which was higher caste.
Squirrel steals dog's needle: enmity between them.
Why cat and dog fight: dog ate up cat's part in master's reward.
Present habitat of animals result of ancient quarrel.
Two animals learn songs together unsuccessfully.
Origin of animal characteristics: animal persuaded into selfinjury.
Animal persuaded to amputate limb: therefore lacks it.
Bustard persuaded to kill all but two children: has but two eggs.
Worm, thinking that world is coming to end, blinds self so as not to see calamity.
Elephant tricked into eating own testicles. Has them inside.
Coyote persuaded to break leg: therefore has thin right leg.
Jackal persuades hyena to jump and break foot. Latter has short left hind foot.
Animal characteristics established by deity. Am.
God makes serpent ugly.
Creation interrupted since God must go to a fire.
Animal characteristics because creator had not enough time to finish what he began. S. Am.
Creation of hog incomplete since God has to go to a fire: cause of hog's round snout.
Animal characteristics result of contest between God and devil.
Devil's animals devour God's. God makes white fish, devil a pike to eat it up; God a worm, devil a frog to eat it, etc. (Cf. A1751.)
Devil gives horse four eyes; God reduces them to two.
Devil's cows one-horned; God makes them two-horned.
God changes color (tails) of devil's cows. Devil makes all animals of same color (or all tailless). When God makes them of different colors (or with tails) devil no longer recognizes them.
Jesus causes animal characteristics.
Jesus drives evil spirits into hogs: hence short snouts.
Jesus drives evil spirits into hogs: hence "toes" on back of foreleg.

Animal characteristics obtained during deluge. Am. Escape from deluge. Birds cling to sky in flood: cause of tail colors. Griffin disdains to go on ark; drowned: hence extinct. Raven does not return to Noah: must suffer thirst and break bill. Unicorn thrown from ark and drowned: hence they no longer exist. Magpie is hybrid of dove and raven; was not baptized by water of the flood in Noah's time. Male rabbit bears young. Female rabbit escaped Noah on ark and drowned.
Animal characteristics: change for convenience.
Wild animals lose their ferocity through fear of Behemoth.
Origin of animal characteristics: body.
Shape of bee's body.
Animal's body made larger. Balys. Mouse's body made larger. Spider's body made larger. Kroeber JAFL XXXII
Coyote's body made larger.
Bat's body made larger.
Flying-squirrel's body made larger.
Animal's body made smaller. Balys. Mouse's body made smaller.
Hazel-cock's body made smaller.
Squirrel's body made smaller.
Eagle's body made smaller.
Wolf's body made smaller.
Lice made smaller.
Origin of animal's flat body.
Origin of fish's flat body.
Origin of steel-head salmon's flat body.
Origin of flounder's flat body.
Why lobster is flat.
Chinese: Eberhard Why bedbug is flat.
Why animal is slippery.
Why eel is slippery.
Origin of animal characteristics: body covering.
Origin of animal's skin.
Origin of dog's skin.
Origin of cat's skin.
Origin of wolf's skin.
Origin of hedgehog's skin.
Dh III 7. IndoneOrigin of porcupine's skin.
Origin of cow's and buffalo's hides.
Why crocodile has rough skin.
Why frog has rough skin.
Why snakes and lizards change skins.
Origin of animal shell.
Origin of tortoise's shell. Tortoise given hard shell when it ferries rice-goddess across stream.
Origin of cracks in tortoise's shell.
Origin of snail's shell.
Origin of dents in crab's shell.
Origin of bird's feathers. How ostrich lost beautiful feathers.
Origin of cuckoo's feathers. Dh.
Origin of magpie's feathers. Exchanges with dove.
Origin of peacock's feathers.
Origin of nkundak's feathers.
Why young ravens have white feathers.
Origin of fish's scales.
Origin of shell-fish's black scales.
Origin of alligator's scales. Am.
Why certain animals are bare of covering.
Why swine's belly is bare.
Why fly is bald.
Why buzzard is bald. Skinner JAFL
Why crow's head is bald.
Why raven is bald. Teit JAFL XXXII
Why magpie is bald.
Why vulture is bald. Dh. Skinner und Satterlee PaAm XIII 78; S. Am.
Why bat'is bald.
Why bird's feet are bare.
Why baboon has bare place on back.
Why john-crow has bald head.
Why opossum has bare tail. Am. Alexander N. Am.
Why kangaroo-rat's tail is not bushy.
Why jackal has bare tail. Jackal and leopard tie tails together for mutual protection. Frightened, they run apart and injure each other.
Why rat's tail is round and without any hair.
Origin of animal characteristics: head.
How snake got small head.
Why weaver bird's head is small.
How turtle got snake-like head.
How lizard got red head.
Origin of mudhen's red head.
Why crab has no head.
Why bird's head is so large.
Why crocodile has marks of water pot on head.
Why palm-rat has swollen head.
Origin of bird crests. Teit JAFL XXXII
Origin of goose's crest.
Origin of hoopoe's crest.
Origin of woodpecker's crest.
Origin of crested-lark's crest.
Origin of kingfisher's crest.
Origin of nkundak's crest.
Origin of buzzard's crest. Alexander N. Am.
Origin of red lump on rail's head.
Origin of willow-grouse's crest.
Origin of cock's red crest.
Why the cock's comb becomes white when he is angry.
Origin of woodpecker's crest.
Origin of hair and mane.
How buffalo got hair under chin.
How zebra got its mane.
How goat got his beard.
How goat got his mane.
Why sheep may keep wool which grows on his forehead.
Why the gorilla and chimpanzee have hair all over the body. Punishment for not guarding possessions at creation.
Origin of animals' ears.
Why rabbit has long ears.
Why hare's ears are black.
Why ass has long ears.
Why camel has short ears.
Why zebra has long ears.
Why cat has jagged ears.
Why camel has no ears.
Why serpent has no ears.
Origin and nature of animal's horns.
How animals got horns.
How stag got antlers. From camel.
Why deer has antlers: as reward for not cheating.
How caribou got antlers. Exchanged his teeth for walrus's horns.
How sheep got horns.
How ox got horns. Exchanged for horse's teeth.
How goats got horns.
How horned-viper got horns.
Why some animals have no horns.
Why cats have no horns.
Why dog has no horns: they were stolen by deer (goat).
Originally cock had horns.
Nature of animal's horns.
Why cows have two horns.
How stag got long antlers.
Why antelope's antlers reach backward.
Why buffalo's horns are bent.
Why mountain-sheep's horns are close together.
Origin of animal characteristics: face.
How wildcat got his mashed face.
How lynx got his squint.
Why monkey's face is black.
Origin of marks on tiger's face. Markings of mammals.
Why flea's face is red.
Why pheasant's cheeks are red.
Why dove's head is marked as it is.
Origin and nature of animals' eyes.
Origin of animals' eyes.
How mouse got his eyes.
How fly got his eyes.
How herring got his eyes.
How fox got his eyes. Stole from birch tree.
Where owl got his eyes.
Number of animal's eyes.
Why horse has only two eyes.
Size of animals' eyes.
Why lemur has big eyes.
Why zabi's eyes are narrow: because he laughs so hard. Rabbit laughs: cause of harelip.
Why caribou has small eyes.
Shape and position of animal's eyes.
Why hare has deep-set eyes.
Why crab lifts eye out of body or has eye behind.
Why frog's eyes bulge out.
Color of animal's eyes.
Why coyote has yellowish eyes.
Why cuckoo has red eyes.
Why water-hen has red eyes.
Why toad has red eyes.
Why turkey has red eyes.
Why wooddove has green eyes.

Helpful animal an enchanted person. Magic dog transformed person. Transformation to eagle to carry hero to safety.
Helpful animal reincarnation of parent. The dead mother ap- pears to the heroine in the form of an animal. Supernatural helpers.
Helpful animal reincarnation of murdered child.
Helpful animal brothers-in-law. Mar- riage to person in animal form.
Animal helpful after being conquered.
Abused and pampered horses. Hero is ordered by ogre to feed and care for certain horse and to neglect other horse. Hero disobeys and feeds neglected horse. Latter is enchanted prince and helps hero.
Helpful bird hatched by hero. Hero holds eagle's egg in hand and hatches it. Young eagle becomes his helper.
Helpful animals transformed from other animals. Dragon from transformed horse. Transformation: one animal to another.
Helpful animal otherwise acquired.
Helpful animal sent by God (or a god).
Helpful animal acquired as reward for vigil.
Reward of helpful animal.
Helpful animal demands food.

Hero feeds own flesh to helpful animal. The hero is carried on the back of an eagle who demands food. The hero finally feeds parts of his own flesh. Köhler- Bolte Zs. f. Vksk. Eagle carries man to safety. Return from lower world on eagle. Water-spirit demands food from those it takes across stream. Man sewed in animal's hide carried off by birds. Hero sewed up in animal hide so as to be carried to height by bird.
Helpful birds demand food.
Animal bribed for help.

Animal bribed with food. Hound of hell. Animal grateful for food. Giants appeased by feeding them. Captive throws his hat to lions who fight over it while he escapes. Thief tries to feed watchdog and stop his mouth: dog detects plan. -

Death of helpful animal. Treasure found in slain helpful animal. Magic animal killed. Tabu: eating animal helper. Mare from water world disappears when she is scolded and her halter used for common purposes. Helpful animal disappears when tabu is broken. Magic object found on grave of slain helpful animal. Magic treasure animal killed: goose that laid the golden egg.
Helpful animal killed through misunderstanding.
Faithful falcon killed through misunderstanding. Tries to warn the king against drinking water poisoned by snake. Hasty killing or condemnation. The falcon of Federigo.
Faithful horse killed through misunderstanding. Tries to warn king against drinking water poisoned by snake.

Llewellyn and his dog. Dog has saved child from serpent. Father sees bloody mouth, thinks the dog has eaten the child, and kills the dog. Baughman. Dog defends master's child against animal assailant. When in anger say the alphabet. Lover kills self believing his mistress dead.
Woman slays faithful mongoose which has saved her child.
B449. Faithful dog killed by overhasty master: thinks mistakenly he has returned home against orders.
Faithful parrot killed by mistake.
Too watchful dog killed.
Helpful animal killed by hero's enemy. The helpful magic horse is killed. -
Man attempts to kill faithful serpent at wife's instigation. Loses everything. Treacherous wife.
Treacherous wife forces husband to kill helpful dog.

Life of helpful animal demanded as cure for feigned sickness. Magic object destroyed because of feigned sickness. Quest assigned because of feigned illness. Flesh of certain animal alleged to be only cure for disease: animal to be killed. Sacrifice of child demanded as cure for feigned sickness. Banishment of stepchildren demanded as cure for feigned illness. Life of children demanded as cure for feigned illness.
Unsuccessful attempt by enemy to kill helpful animal.

Wife demands magic parrot who has accused her. Bird betrays women's infidelity. Cocks who crow about mistress's adultery killed. Parrot unable to tell husband details as to wife's infidelity. Adulteress outwits husband.
Faithful animal killed in battle.
A small animal (hare, bitch) gives timely warnings to the hero about the trap prepared by his enemy. Animal warning about trap killed.
Helpful cow to be killed because of refusal to help stepdaughter.
Helpful animal killed (threatened) by ungrateful hero. Meinhof Afrikanische Mär- chen 9ff. Ingratitude.
Weapons made from bones of helpful horse.
Death of helpful animal - miscellaneous.
Truth-telling dog killed so as to hide murder.
Treatment of helpful animals - miscellaneous.
Helpful animal's injunctions disobeyed. Disaster follows.

Cat leaves house when report is made of death of one of his companions. His master has been told to say "Robert is dead". As soon as this is said, the cat leaves. Baughman; Taylor Washington University Studies X (Hum. Spirit leaves when report is made of the death of one of its kind.
Large reward given for return of helpful animal.
Grateful animals.
B311. Congenital helpful animal. Grateful objects. The grateful dead. Deeds rewarded. Gratitude. Animals grateful for rescue from peril of death. Reward for rescuer.
Animals grateful for rescue from pit. Capture in pitfall. Grateful animals; ungrateful man.
Animal grateful for rescue from drowning.
Animal grateful for rescue from net.
Lion is freed from net by mouse. Mouse asks that his son marry lion's daughter. Request granted. The mouse is trampled to death by his bride.

Fish returned to water: grateful. Two special forms of this motif are common; in both the fish is returned to the water and rewards the captor. The "King of the Fishes" form: a man captures the king of fishes (B243) who as a reward for the re- lease tells the man to feed parts of his body (when he is later cap- tured) to his wife and parts to certain animals. The king of the fishes in this case grants the man's wife the power of fulfilling all her wi- Magic fish. Speaking fish. Helpful fish. Ma- gic object received from animal. Fish promises to spare man in coming flood. Conception from eating fish.
Grateful fish grants mad hero his wish; to impregnate a prin- cess. Later the fish saves the hero and his family from death at sea.
Fish grateful for being transferred from tank to river.

Magic power from animals. Dog whose skin turns water into wine. by helpful animal. Magic object a gift. Acquisition of magic power. Magic strength from helping animal. Animal gives part of body as talisman for summoning its aid. Sébillot Incidents s.v. Transformation by putting on claw, feather, etc. of helpful animal. Magic feather. Magic hair of animal. Magic object summons helper. Animals magically called.
Buffalo give hero horns for summoning them. Magic animal horn. Buffalo magically called. rescue.
Merry horn and angry horn for summoning buffalo. When all is well hero is to blow on merry-horn; when in trouble on angry- horn.
Kite teaches rhyme by which he may be summoned for help.
Animal gives jewel for summoning him when in need of help.

Healing by animals. Magic object gives health. Magic object controls disease. Magic healing power. Marvelous cures.
Animal as healer.
Snake as healer. Helpful serpent.
Snake creeps into man's mouth and heals him. No

Medicine shown by animal. It heals another animal with a medi- cine (herb, water, etc.) and thus shows the man the remedy. Some- times the medicine resuscitates the dead. (The animal is most fre- quently the serpent. *Krappe Papers and Trans. of Jubilee Cong. Magic leaf. Magic plant. Magic healing water. Magic water restores sight. Water of life. Means of resuscitation learned. Secret remedy overheard in conversation of animals (witches). Grateful animals; ungrateful man.

Remedy learned from overhearing animal meeting. The hero learns how to cure his own blindness and the sickness of the king (princess). Secrets discussed in animal meeting. Animals tell hero their secrets.
Animal fetches remedy for man.
Grateful fox fetches fox liver as remedy. Helpful fox.
Bee fetches balm from heaven to restore hero's speech.
Snake gives man antidote for poison.
D1317. Magic object protects from poison. Magic antidote for poison. Resuscitation by animals. Resuscitation.
Sight restored by animal.

Animals save person's life. Eyes of hero's buffalo friend turn into two powerful dogs that protect his wife. Substitute smoker. Escape by help of confederate. Monkey saves condemned birds through feigned dream. K644, Monkey attracts attention of mowers until young birds can fly away from the harvest field. Animals help in military victory. Fugitives aided by a helpful animal.
Animal warns of fatal danger. Prophetic animals. Fugitives aided by a helpful animal.
Animal warns against poison.

- B131. Peacock's feathers ruffled in presence of poison. Magic object protects from poison. Magic antidote for poison. Horse advises hero not to wash in water (as his false wife told him to) or his eyes will pop out.
Animal warns man against drinking.
Animal warns against accident.
Eagle saves man from falling wall. The grateful eagle swoops down and takes the man's hat, and thus gets him away from the wall that is about to fall.
Animals warn against attack. Horse warns of danger. Bird gives warning. Magic object warns of danger.
Dogs warn against witch. Recognition of witches.
Cackling geese spread alarm. Animal as guard of person or house.
Flea's bite alarms king. Robber tells flea of plan to rob king. During the robbery the flea bites and awakens the king.
Prince awakened by fly on his nose in time to save himself from enemy.
Dog warns of pursuit.

Owl saves man from plunging over cliff. Flaps wings and ar- rests man's attention.

Serpent shows condemned man how to save prince's life. Bites the prince and then shows the man the proper remedy (cf. B512). By thus ingratiating himself the man is freed from false accusation. Grateful animals; ungrateful man.
— ― Kite steals jewels and thus saves condemned man. Innocent man in possession of stolen jewels, is about to be apprehended. Kite car- ries off the jewels and saves him.

- N352. Bird carries off ring which lover has taken from sleeping mistress' finger. He searches for the ring and becomes separated from her. Woman slandered as adulteress is thrown into lion pit. Circling cranes carry away girl.

Fish carries man across water. Magic salmon carries hero over water. Escape from sea on fish's back. Water-spirit demands food from those it takes across stream. Winged serpent as boat: passengers within. Turtle carrying man through water upsets him because of a broken promise.
Fish carries man to upper world. A.
Acquatic bird carries man across water.
Parrots carry couple across the sea.
Crocodile carries man across river (ocean).
Water snake carries boy across river. Woman promises unborn daughter to snake as wife for ferrying her across stream.
Turtle (tortoise) carries person across river (ocean).

Man carried by bird. Flying horse. Helpful bird. Eagle carries off condemned child. Hero carried by bird to mistress' chamber. Magic object bears person aloft. Souls carried to heaven by doves. Bird carries person to or from upper world. Eagle carries giant to its nest. Extraordinary flights through air. Hero sewed up in animal hide so as to be carried to height by bird.
Alexander carried by two birds with meat held in front of them. Flight so high that eyelids drop from cold.
Man carried by peacock.
Indra carried by cock.
Animals serve as bridge across stream.
Sea-beast allows voyager to land upon his back. Whale raises back so that voyaging clerics can celebrate Easter.

Unusual animal as riding-horse. Jewish: Bin Gorion Born Judas2 Gods with unusual riding or draft animals. Thumbling has cat as riding horse. Man rides on back of fleeing wild boar. Witch rides on unusual animal. Numskull rides on tiger's back. Trickster rides dupe horseback.

call. Animal calls the dawn. Chanticleer believes that his crowing makes the sun rise. Wolf announces dawn prematurely to collect debt.

Patient fed salt: animal comes out for water. The patient is fed salt or heavily salted food and allowed no water for several days. Noah's curse admits devil to ark. Devil persuades Noah's wife to stay out of ark till Noah shall call devil in. Noah at last loses patience and calls out, "The devil! The devil comes in and turns himself into a mouse. Dh. The devil gets into the ark. Noah's secret betrayed by his wife.

Looking tabu. Am. Magic journey with closed eyes. Person must not open eyes while on the journey. Vampire's power overcome by endurance and prayer. Hero continues to pray without looking or speaking while vampire punishes him.

D513. Man looks at copulating snakes: transformed to woman. Tabu: seeing the supernatural. Tabu: looking at supernatural wife. Tabu: looking at supernatural husband. Tabu: spying on secret help of angels.

Tabu: looking at ghosts. Sight of dead woman spinning drives people insane.

Gods flee at approach of dawn.

Tabu: man looking at nude goddess. Tabu: looking at supernatural wife naked. Tabu: being in presence of god. Loss of sight for breaking tabu. Personal offences against gods punished. Punishment: transformation to deer which is devoured by dogs.

Tabu: looking into box (Pandora). Köhler notes to Gonzenbach Sicilianische Märchen No. 15. Troubles escape when forbidden casket is opened. Music-box continues playing when it is touched contrary to tabu. Death by smothering for breaking tabu. Casket with Good Luck in it given to men by Zeus.
Tabu: opening too much of magic box at a time. A priest gives a prince a sealed packet which he is to open in time of distress. He must open only one portion at a time.
Tabu: opening gift box prematurely. Tabu: doing thing too soon. Tabu: looking into bag. Looking tabu broken.
Bag of winds. Wind is confined in a bag. Man breaks prohibition against looking into bag and releases winds. Released.
Tabu: opening bag too soon.
Tabu: looking into flask. Man given magic flask on condition that he never look into it. Magic bottle supplies drink,.
Tabu: looking into jug. Woman does so and finds mouse in it. Test of curiosity: mouse in jug.
Tabu: looking into magic calabash.
Tabu: looking into the pots in hell. Souls of drowned in heated kettles in hell. Kettle heating in hell for certain person.
Tabu: looking under certain bell too soon.
Tabu: looking into basket.
Tabu: opening corpse-wrapping.
Tabu: looking in certain direction. Lemur looks where forbidden: has big eyes.

Tabu: looking back. Tabu: man looking at nude goddess. Tabu: carrying child back into house. Man receives fork in eye for breaking tabu. Person must remain in other world because of broken tabu. Transformation to pillar of salt because of breaking tabu. Transformation to stone for breaking tabu. Orpheus, Journey to land of dead to bring back person from the dead.
Tabu: looking back over left shoulder.
Travelers to other world must not look back.
Tabu: looking back during flight.
Tabu: looking around.
Tabu: looking up.
