Speaking tabu. Silence under punishment breaks power of enchantment. Vampire's power overcome by endurance and prayer. Hero continues to pray without looking or speaking while vampire punishes him. The dead are silent. Task: shouting from forbidden place. Loss of speech as punishment.
Tabu: speaking during certain time. Tabu: doing thing during certain time. Disenchantment by maintaining silence. Magic dumbness. Loss of speech as punishment. Penance: not to speak.
Tabu: speaking during vigil. Test: speechless vigil in church.
Tabu: speaking during seven days of danger. As result of pro- phecy of seven days of danger, an injunction of silence is imposed during this period.
Tabu: speaking while searching for treasure. Unlucky encounter causes treasure-seekers to talk and thus lose treasure.
Tabu: speaking about lost money which is to be regained by witchcraft. The loser cannot refrain from speaking of his loss; the money cannot be recovered. Baughman.
Tabu: speaking while raising sunken church bell. Church bell cannot be raised because silence is broken.
Tabu: speaking while gathering fernseed to make wishes come true, at midnight on Christmas Eve when fernseed ripens and falls immediately.
Tabu: speaking while taking a bath.
Tabu: speaking before certain time. Tabu: doing thing before certain time.
Tabu: king speaking before his druids speak. Tabu: things not to be done by certain class. Tabus of kings.
Tabu: people speaking before king speaks.
Silence preserved in fairyland. The dead are silent.
Tabu: asking questions. The one compulsory question.

Tabu: asking about marvels which one sees. Hero must ask meaning of strange sights he sees (Percival). "Do not ask questions about extraordinary things": counsel proved wise by experience. Those that ask question killed.
Tabu: asking for reason of an unusual action. Spanish Exempla: Keller; Persian: Bricteux Contes Persans 97 No. 4; Indonesian: De Vries Volksverhalen I No. 35 n.
Tabu: expressing surprise in lower world of dead. Tabu: showing surprise when supernatural husband resumes his true shape. Tabus connected with otherworld journeys.
Tabu: asking prophet for signs.

Tabu: uttering secrets. Tabu: revealing secrets of supernatural wife. Tabu: finding certain secret. Recogni- tion by overheard conversation with animals or objects. Person not daring to reveal self directly thus attracts attention. "Do not tell a secret to a woman". Secret of strength treacherously discovered. Daughter pulls out father's magic lifecontaining hair. Valu- able secrets learned. Reward for ability to keep secrets. Meddling punished. Wife threatens husband with death if he will not tell secrets.
Man (woman) persuaded to reveal fatal secret.
Tabu: not to speak about a certain happening. Tests of friendship.
Tabu: uttering secret overheard.

Tabu: revealing secret of supernatural husband. Tabu: revealing secrets of supernatural wife. Tabu: offending supernatural husband. Tabu: looking at supernatural husband. Tabu: staying at home too long. soon.

Tabu: revealing sacred mysteries.
Tabu: telling children about lake monster.

Tabu: revealing knowledge of animal languages. Animal languages learned. Tiger lets man go on condition he does not tell what he has overheard. Laugh reveals secret knowledge. Wife threatens husband with death if he will not tell secrets.
Tabu: revealing secret song.
Tabu: revealing help of grateful animal.
Tabu: revealing time of Messiah's advent.

A138. Tabu: offending supernatural wife. Tabu: revealing name of god. Personal offences against gods punished. Tabu: uttering name of supernatural creature. He appears.
Guessing name of supernatural creature gives power over him. Ghosts exorcised by name. Fairy leaves when he is named. Secret name overheard by eavesdropper.

Person obnoxious for his sins spoken of as "the other".

Tabu: uttering name of supernatural wife. Tabu: offending supernatural wife.
Woman (fairy) causes twofold death of mortal husband who utters her name. Extraordinary twofold death.

Tabu: uttering name of sister-in-law.
Tabu: disclosing own identity. A supernatural person must not tell who he is.
Tabu: giving child a name lest it die early. Care of children.

Origin tabu. Prohibition against mention of origin of person or thing. Tabu: mentioning origin of supernatural wife. tioning origin of supernatural child. Tabu: mentioning origin of animal wife. Person returns to original form when tabu is broken.
Tabu: mentioning original form of transformed person. Marriage of person to animal.
Family dares not discuss tigers, fearing that son in form of tiger will return. Chinese.

Tabu: whistling.

Tabu: coughing.
Tabu: coughing in other world.
Other speaking tabus.
Substitutes for tabu expressions.
Save it for the beggar (substitute for "save it for tomorrow". You may be dead by tomorrow.)
Tabu: expressing astonishment at marvel. Transformation when one expresses astonishment at smith drawing water in an egg-shell.
Tabu: screaming at terrible sight.
Tabu: speaking to strangers.
Tabu: thanking (under certain circumstances). d. Abergl.
Tabu: wishing good luck. One must not wish a hunter good luck or a sailor good voyage. Acts performed for changing luck.
Tabu: cursing. Curses.
Tabu: using any except one certain phrase. Judge fails to ask proper question.
All questions to be answered, "I don't know". A youth is so advised by his horse.
We three "For gold" "That is right". These expressions are the sole conversation of three men.
We three "For gold" "That is right" devil's bargain. Three brothers have agreed to say only these things. They incrimi- nate themselves. Numskulls make silence wager. Arrested as thieves.

We three "For gold" "That is right": phrases of foreign language. Three travelers know each one phrase of a foreign language. They incriminate themselves. Pledge to say but a single phrase. In carrying out this agreement the men innocently confess a crime.
Yes "No"
Very well. Youth is so advised by old woman helper.
Tabu: using obscene language.
Tabu: speaking to the dead. Ghosts and revenants. miscellaneous.
Speaking tabu: the one forbidden expression. Unique prohibition. A person is forbidden to do one particular thing; everything else he is free to do.
Speaking tabu: the one forbidden expression eternal".

Tabu: complimenting.

Tabu: pulling nuts. Girl summons fairy lover by pulling nuts.

Cutting elder tree fatal to man. man.
Cutting white thorn tree fatal to man who cuts it.

Tabu: touching water. Magic wishing-ring loses power by touching water.
Tabu: touching box.
Tabu: touching magic box.

Untouchables. Certain castes whose touch is considered a pollu- tion.

Tabus of kings. Tabu: king speaking before his druids speak. Tabu: king sleeping during sunrise at capital. Kings. No king to rule who is not husband of certain queen. King may not marry girl who has been wife of another.
Tabu: king traveling alone.
Tabu: king having physical blemish. God with one hand. No men with wounds to be sacrificed to goddess. King must resign if maimed.

Tabus of bearded men. Tabu: bearded man sleeping at sunrise. Tabu: bearded man refusing combat. Tabu: bearded man refusing request. Tabu: bearded man going dirty to bed. Only the brave to wear beards.

Tabu: bearded man being lazy.

Tabu: fish hero snaring a being in the bays of his land.
Tabu: birds feeding on hero's land without leaving him some- thing.

Unique prohibition. A person is forbidden to do one particular thing; everything else he is free to do. Paradise lost because of one sin. Speaking tabu: the one forbidden expression. Tabu: fighting certain person. Unique exceptions.
Unique prohibition announced by mysterious voice.

The one forbidden place. Sébillot Incidents s.v. Tabu: trysting with woman at certain place. Tabu: being in certain place at sunrise. Tabu: going to certain place in March. Forbidden chamber. Person allowed to enter all chambers of house except one. Golden finger as sign of opening forbidden chamber. Hair turns to gold as punishment in forbidden chamber. Bloody key as sign of disobedience.
Forbidden door. All doors may be entered except one.
Prince not to be given eighth key until after he has ruled for five years.
Forbidden stables. Person allowed to enter everywhere but into three stables.
Forbidden ladder.
Forbidden forest.
Forbidden road. All roads may be taken except one. Dreadnaughts. Brothers deliberately seek dangers they have been warned against.
Forbidden direction of travel. Person free to go in any other.

Tabu: hunting in certain part of forest.

Tabu: going through a wicket gate.

Tabu: not to rest near a lake.
Certain pool to be approached only when properly attired.

Tree of knowledge forbidden. Tree of knowledge.

The one compulsory question. Percival must ask the meaning of the strange sights he sees; else the Fisher King will not be healed. Voretzsch Altfranz Lit. 325 (Chretien de Troyes Conte del Graal). Tabu: to rest sitting or lying until answer to a certain question is learned. Slamming door on exit from mountain otherworld. It (almost) injures the hero because he has failed to bring back the talisman which opened the mountain. Slamming bridge to other world. Slams as hero leaves and (almost) injures him. He has failed to do the one compulsory thing. Test: finding answer to certain question. Quest: answer to certain question. "Do not ask questions about extraordinary things." Reward for asking proper questions.
Compulsion: taking back talisman which opened treasure moun- tain. Hero takes treasure and forgets the talisman.
Only one certain gift must be accepted.
Only peacock on the steeple of the king's golden temple can be accepted as dowry.
Girl from elfland must eat earthly food in order to remain. Tabu: eating in other world. Tabus connected with other- world journeys. Fairyland. Christianized fairy woman refuses to eat fairy food.
One must eat "death vegetable" whenever one sees it. Otherwise god will be angry.
Compulsion to bathe in certain waters daily.
Injunction: to marry first woman met. Sex tabu. Princess to marry first man who asks for her.
Injunction: to cohabit with first woman met after battle.
Injunction: protect certain stone from molestation.
Compulsion to go to certain place at certain time (or once each year).
The one compulsory song. Beer cannot be brewed until an old man sings the song of the origin of beer. Beer magically kept from brewing.
Compulsion to tell stories.
Curse laid upon man by stories he fails to tell: they creep out of his belly when he is asleep and talk.
Compulsion to give food to everyone met on journey.
Other compulsions.
Compulsion to answer cry. Hero is magically compelled to do so. Tabus of heroes. Tabu: hearing or listening. Crying induced by magic as trick to force child's mother.
Compulsion to regard hunting cry and follow hounds.
Compulsion to invite singer to feast. Until that is done, the beer will not stop foaming.
Injunction: sleep where night overtakes you. Otherwise misfor- tune will come.
Compulsion to perform certain task yearly. Time tabus.
Compulsion to catch blackbird alive yearly.
Compulsion to kill one of certain hogs yearly.
Compulsion to leap yearly over stone one's size held in palm of hand. Tasks contrary to laws of nature.
Compulsion to hold festival at certain intervals.
Injunction: to give sample of food to dog before eating. Misfor- tune follows failure to do so.
Injunction: to forsake woman who arouses love. Sex tabu. Girl as wooer. Man unsuccessfully tempted by woman.
Tabu: to refuse help to a woman.
Injunction: to perform certain act daily. Time tabus.
Injunction: to visit saint daily.

Tabu: merman's wife not to stay till church benediction. Sight of old home reawakens memory and brings about return from other world. Exorcising fairies. Fairies disappear when some name of ceremony of the Christian Church is used. Trolls cannot endure churchbells. Prayer.

Monster born because of hasty (inconsiderate) wish of parents. Childless couple promise child to the devil if they may only have one. Child born in answer to prayer. Thumbling born as result of hasty wish of parents. They wish for a child, no matter how small he may be.

Tabu: loosing bridle in selling man transformed to horse. by putting on bridle. Protean sale. Disenchantment by taking off bridle. Magic bridle.

Tabu: killing animal which takes refuge with one.
Tabu: killing stork. Bird was once maiden. Tabu: killing stork as sacred being. Bad luck follows man who shoots stork.

Supernatural being punishes breach of tabu.
Dwarf punishes for breach of tabu.
Moon punishes for breach of tabu.

Golden finger as sign of opening forbidden chamber. Transformation: objects to gold. Magic wealth.
Hair turns to gold as punishment in forbidden chamber. Transformation: hair to gold. Hair furnishes treasure. Magic wealth.
Bloody key as sign of disobedience. Transformation: key becomes bloody. Magic key. Indelible blood.
Bloody egg as sign of disobedience.
Contents of forbidden receptacle are released.
Troubles escape when forbidden casket is opened.

Music-box continues playing when it is touched contrary to tabu. Köhler's notes to Gonzenbach Sicilianische Märchen No. 15. Looking tabu broken. Bag of winds. Wind is confined in a bag. Man breaks prohibition against looking into bag and releases winds.
Animals escape when forbidden baskets opened. Origin of ani- mals. Creation of animals as punishment for beating forbidden drum.
Animals escape when forbidden calabash is opened.
Continuous action started by breaking tabu. The cursed dancers. Dancers rude to holy man cursed and must keep dancing till Judgment Day. Magic results from eating or drinking. Continuing magic acts.
Trespass betrayed by dripping candle.
Animals produced when forbidden drum is beaten. Creation of animals as punishment for beating forbidden drum. Crab beats deity's forbidden drum: eyes lift out of body.

Magic porridge-pot keeps cooking. Against command, mother of owner bids pot to cook. It fills house with porridge and will not stop until ordered by mistress. Why the sea is salt. Magic salt mill is stolen by sea-captain, who takes it aboard and orders it to grind. It will stop only for its master; ship sinks and keeps grinding salt. Magic pot. Magic cooking-pot obeys only master.
Spinning wheel continues spinning because woman has worked at forbidden time.
Object magically appears when tabu is broken.
Tabued pot broken: town appears.
Mare from water world disappears when she is scolded and her halter used for common purposes. Tabu: offending water spirits. Animal dives into lake and disappears.
Marvelous cow offended disappears. Cow with inexhaustible milk.

Death for breaking tabu. Fairies take vengeance for destruction of fairy mound. Death as punishment for broken oath. Vain attempts to escape fulfillment of prophecy. Inexorable fate: death for violating tabus. Death as punishment.
Death of children for breaking tabu.
Death of wife for breaking tabu.
Immediate death for breaking tabu. Tabu: failing to make gift to magic lance. The lance kills.

Death by smothering for breaking tabu. Man given secret box conveying the power of making women love him. ning and opens it. The women smother him to death. Love-compelling man sickens of bargain. Man on Island of Fair Women overcome by loving women.
Death by choking for breaking tabu. Murder by choking.
Death by drowning for breaking tabu. Lake from violating tabu. Flood as punishment. Desecrated well overflows. Prodigy as punishment.
Death by thirst for breaking tabu.
Death from rattlesnake bite because of breaking tabu. Calif.
Man (woman) vanishes on breaking of tabu.
Burning as punishment for breaking tabu.
Person turned to dust.
Falling to ashes as punishment for breaking tabu. Person magically reduced to ashes. Tabu: touching ground on return from fairyland.
Burning and drowning as punishment for breaking tabu. Woman causes twofold death of mortal husband who utters her name. Murder by burning. Souls in hell alternatively drown and burn.
Death from insanity as punishment for breaking tabu. Insanity for breaking tabu.
Death for breaking tabu miscellaneous.
Shame and disgrace threatened for refusing love of forth- putting woman. Girl as wooer.
Death from specific disease for breaking tabu.
Death from paralysis for breaking tabu.
Beheading for breaking tabu.
Death by stoning for breaking tabu.
Death by being swallowed for breaking tabu.
Man sacrificed to the gods for breaking tabu.
Loss of fortune for breaking tabu. Clerics' voyage unsuccessful because they sailed in boats of skin. Fitting destruction (disappearance) of property as punishment.
Dishonor to children because of breaking tabu.
Building falls because of breaking of tabu. Fortress built on Sunday destroyed by tempest.
Loss of wife (husband) for breaking tabu. Tabu: offending supernatural wife. Quest for vanished husband.
Luck in hunting (fishing) lost for breaking tabu.
Luck in hunting lost for breaking tabu. Africa.
Luck in fishing lost for breaking tabu.
Food supply fails because of broken tabu.
Loss of crops because of broken tabu.
Land made sterile because of broken tabu. Land made magically sterile.
Elves set country afire because of broken tabu. Fairies set fire to buildings.
Helpful animal disappears when tabu is broken. Mare from water world disappears when she is scolded and her halter used for common purposes.
War lost because of breaking tabu.
God's favor lost for breaking tabu. Paradise lost because of one sin.
Immortality lost because of breach of tabu.
A1335. Origin of death. Rulers of inferior character after tabu is broken. Kings. Failure of crops during reign of wicked king. miscellaneous.
Loss of fortune for breaking tabu.
Punishment for breaking tabu: water withdrawn from lake.
